0.title: Rahul Gandhi visits temple, mosque & church in K'taka, shares pics
0.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited Sri Chamundeshwari Temple, Masjid-e-Azam and St Philomena's Cathedral in Karnataka's Mysuru district on Monday during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Sharing pictures from the three religious sites on social media, Rahul said that religious harmony is the foundation of India's peaceful and progressive future. He began the 26th day of the yatra on Monday.

1.title: Delhi HC asks man to give burgers to orphanages in return for quashing FIR
1.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed a man to provide burgers to two orphanages as a condition for quashing a rape FIR registered against him. Police have been directed to ensure that the burgers are well-made and cooked in a clean environment. Noting that the complainant and the accused were married earlier, the court said the dispute appeared to be matrimonial.

2.title: 2 college students dead, 5 injured as car crashes into shop in Pune
2.article_body: Two MIT College students died and five of their friends were injured after the car they were travelling in crashed into a shop in Pune on Tuesday, police said. "They were going towards Saswad and had plans to see...sunrise, but the person driving the vehicle lost control, leading to the accident," police said. The deceased were aged 18 and 19.

3.title: Amit Shah condoles death of 10 mountaineers in U'khand avalanche
3.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday condoled the loss of lives in an avalanche in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi. "I have spoken to officials in this regard. Local administration, SDRF, NDRF, ITBP and Army teams are engaged in relief and rescue operations with full readiness," Shah added. Ten trainee mountaineers have been killed in the avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak.

4.title: Ajay Devgn's VFX company denies working on 'Adipurush' amid backlash
4.article_body: Trade analyst Taran Adarsh shared a statement by Ajay Devgn's VFX company NY VFXwaala clarifying their involvement in Prabhas-starrer 'Adipurush' amid online backlash over its CGI effects. "Leading VFX studio, NY VFXWalla has clarified...they've not worked/are not working on the CG/special effects of 'Adipurush'," the statement read. The film is directed by Om Raut and also features Kriti Sanon.

5.title: Satellite mapping & geofencing important to detect encroachments: SC
5.article_body: The Supreme Court has said that satellite mapping and geofencing are extremely important considering that unauthorised construction is a perennial problem. "It is necessary that the modern technologies for satellite mapping of lands and buildings to detect encroachments, illegal constructions and geofencing of lands for prompt monitoring take place," said the court.

6.title: President Murmu, actor Prabhas to be chief guests on Dussehra in Delhi
6.article_body: Delhi's famous Lav Kush Ramlila Committee is set to celebrate Dussehra with three chief guests this year. President Droupadi Murmu, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Baahubali actor Prabhas will attend the mega event at the iconic Red Fort ground on Dussehra. A total of nine effigies have been made this year for the grand finale.

7.title: Alcaraz, Nadal make history as world's top two players from Spain
7.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal made history when they became the top two ranked players in the world from Spain on Monday. Following this, world number one Alcaraz said, "Proud to share this historic moment with Nadal, the best player of all time!" With Alcaraz already at world number one, Nadal climbed past Casper Ruud to become world number two.

8.title: Poster outside RJD office showing Opp'n unity portrays Lalu Yadav as Lord Vishnu
8.article_body: A poster outside Rashtriya Janata Dal's (RJD) office in Bihar's Patna showing Opposition unity portrays party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav as an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The poster also portrays Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as Arjun and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav as Shree Krishna. "Strong objection must be taken for insult of our Hindu gods!" said BJP worker Priti Gandhi.

9.title: 4 women chosen to run world's most remote post office & count penguins in Antarctica
9.article_body: Four women have been selected from 6,000 candidates to run the world's most remote post office and count penguins in Antarctica. Clare Ballantyne, Mairi Hilton, Natalie Corbett and Lucy Bruzzone will travel 9,000 miles from the UK to manage the historic site of Port Lockroy, on Goudier Island. They will spend five months without electricity, running water or flushing toilet.

10.title: It's an amazing time for women in cinema right now: Madhuri Dixit
10.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that earlier there were many talented actresses and "so few" good roles for women. "Now that they are being written, they are giving all these artistes a chance to show what they can do with all these roles," she added. "It's an amazing time for women in cinema right now," she added.

11.title: Several French cities to ban Qatar FIFA WC fan zones over humanitarian issues
11.article_body: Several French cities, including Lille, Strasbourg and Bordeaux, have decided to not organise fan zones or put up giant TV screens to show the matches of the upcoming FIFA World Cup. The decision is taken in protest against the alleged ecological and humanitarian abuses in Qatar. Lille Mayor Martine Aubry called the WC "nonsense in terms of human rights".

12.title: The passes are insane, we find each other: Haaland on Kevin De Bruyne
12.article_body: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland, who has now scored 14 goals in eight Premier League games, has opened up on his "chemistry" with their midfielder Kevin De Bruyne, stating that "they find each other" during matches. Haaland added, "It's natural, that I go on the run, and he finds me. When this feels natural, there is nothing better."

13.title: Acting like robot wasn't easy for me: Angad Bedi on 'The List'
13.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi, speaking about playing a robot in the short film 'The List', said, "Acting like robots for me isn't easy." "It's the toughest thing to do and then you have to project certain emotions while you act all robotic," he added. "Working with Kirti (Kulhari) and taking workshops for 5 days helped me a lot," Angad further said.

14.title: Patole made 'cheetah' remark to criticise PM and please Rahul: BJP
14.article_body: Responding to Congress leader Nana Patole's remark that the Centre brought cheetahs to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP's Chandrashekhar Bawankule said that Patole made the remark to criticise PM Narendra Modi and please Rahul Gandhi. "Patole is suffering from some disease...It appears that he is unwell and needs a good doctor," Bawankule said.

15.title: PM Modi wishes citizens on Navami, seeks blessings for everyone
15.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone on the occasion of Navami and sought blessings for all the citizens. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "The Mahanavami of Navratri is dedicated to Mother Siddhidatri. May all of you be inspired to walk on the path of duty as well as achieve success in life. Heartiest congratulations!"

16.title: President Murmu launches 'herSTART', startup platform for women entrepreneurs
16.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu launched 'herSTART', a startup platform of the Gujarat University, in Ahmedabad, for women entrepreneurs on Tuesday. She said that this platform will not only boost innovation and start-up efforts of women entrepreneurs but also prove to be an effective platform in connecting women entrepreneurs with various government and private enterprises.

17.title: 3 more arrested in Arunachal Pradesh paper leak case
17.article_body: Three more people were arrested in connection with the Arunachal Pradesh Public Service Commission Assistant Engineer (Civil) examination question paper leak. With this, the total number of arrests in the case has risen to nine. The state government has recommended a CBI probe into the case. The matter was taken over by the special investigation cell (vigilance) on September 27.

18.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 69-yr-old preacher accused of rape
18.article_body: The Bombay High Court granted pre-arrest bail to a 69-year-old businessman-turned-spiritual preacher from Panvel, who is accused of raping a woman over the past 28 years. The court directed to release the accused on bail on furnishing a personal bond of ₹ 25,000 and surrender his mobile to the investigating officer. The victim lodged her complaint only a month ago.

19.title: Kenya lifts ban on genetically modified crops in response to drought
19.article_body: Kenya on Monday lifted a ban on openly cultivating genetically modified crops, reversing a decade-old decision in response to the worst drought to affect the East African region in 40 years. "Open cultivation and importation of White Maize are now authorised," Kenyan President William Ruto's office said. Authorities are hoping that the move will improve crop yields and food security.

20.title: US, South Korea conduct bombing drills after North Korea fired missile
20.article_body: The US and South Korea conducted bombing drills after North Korea fired a missile over Japan, South Korean military said. It was North Korea's first missile to fly over Japan since 2017 and fifth launch in 10 days. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida called the action "barbaric". The launch prompted warning in northern Japan and residents were urged to take shelter.

21.title: Will probe irregularities in AAP's power subsidy scheme: Delhi L-G
21.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Tuesday directed the Chief Secretary to inquire into the alleged "irregularities and discrepancies" in the power subsidy given by the AAP government to BSES discoms. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had announced that subsidies will be given on power tariffs to those who opt for it. The LG has sought the report in 7 days.

22.title: 4-yr-old boy attacked by leopard in Mumbai's Aarey Colony
22.article_body: A four-year-old boy was attacked by a leopard on Monday evening in Mumbai's Aarey colony, adjacent to Sanjay Gandhi National Park, forest officials said. The boy, Himanshu Yadav, has been admitted to a hospital with claw injuries on his back, according to an official. The incident allegedly took place when Yadav was going to play garba with his family members.

23.title: K'taka road spray-painted with 'PFI will return' warning, pic surfaces
23.article_body: Days after the government banned Popular Front of India (PFI) and its affiliates, pro-PFI slogans surfaced on a road in Bantwal town of Karnataka's Mangaluru district. Unknown miscreants wrote the slogan 'Beware, PFI will return' in Kannada language on a road in Pilathabettu village on Monday night. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter.

24.title: May you continue to shine with your performances: Uthappa on Pant's birthday
24.article_body: Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa took to Twitter on India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's 25th birthday and wrote, "Happy birthday, champ...May you continue to shine with your performances and entertain us all with your behind the stumps commentary! Lots of love." Pant's teammate Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Happy birthday to my keeper buddy...Have a good one!"

25.title: J&K was ruled by 3 families for 70 yrs, they removed meaning of democracy: Shah
25.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that for 70 years, J&K was ruled by three families and democracy was built only within their families. "Did you ever get the right of Gram Panchayat, Tehsil Panchayat and Zilla Panchayat? Three families had removed the meaning of democracy…only to rule for generations," Shah said during a public rally in Rajouri.

26.title: EU passes law for a single charger for all smartphones from 2024
26.article_body: The European Parliament on Tuesday approved new rules to have a single charging port, USB-C, for all smartphones, tablets and cameras by 2024. The move is expected to affect Apple the most than its rivals, as it will be forced to change its charging port for iPhones. The rule also covers e-readers and earbuds.

27.title: AB de Villiers undergoes eye surgery due to retinal detachment
27.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers revealed during a Twitter Spaces session that he has undergone eye surgery due to retinal detachment. On being asked why he isn't playing Legends League Cricket, De Villiers said, "I'm too old now...I was invited...but I had an eye operation...You might think...I can play with one eye but I'd rather not do that."

28.title: Billionaires Adani, Musk together lose $25 billion in a day as stocks fall: Report
28.article_body: Billionaires Gautam Adani and Elon Musk reportedly lost around $25 billion in a day after the shares of their companies declined on Monday. As per a report, Musk lost $15.5 billion after Tesla's shares recorded the steepest single-day decline of 8.6% in four months, wiping out over $71 billion from its market value. Meanwhile, Adani lost $9.67 billion that day.

29.title: He was as warm as he was 4 yrs ago: Manav on reuniting with co-star Hrithik
29.article_body: Actor Manav Gohil spoke about working with Hrithik Roshan after four years for an ad. The duo worked together in the film 'Super 30'. Manav said, "He is as warm as he was four years ago. We had a brief but good exchange of words. He remembered all the small things that we spoke about during Super 30."

30.title: Baseless claims made to please Rahul: BJP leader on Patole’s 'cheetah' remark
30.article_body: Following Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole’s remark that Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to India to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP’s Chandrashekhar Bawankule said it appears that Patole is "unwell and needs a good doctor". "Baseless claims are being made to criticise PM Narendra Modi and to please Rahul Gandhi so that he can save his position," he stated.

31.title: Russia emerges as India's second largest oil supplier in Sept: Report
31.article_body: India's crude oil imports from Russia rose 18.5% month-on-month (MoM) in September, making it the country's second-largest crude oil supplier after Saudi Arabia, The Economic Times reported. The import of 8.79 lakh barrels per day (bpd) of Russian oil in September is India's second highest monthly import ever. India reportedly received first 90,000 tonnes of Russian naphtha last month.

32.title: 'Has 5G been launched to the public?': Paytm CEO to Airtel
32.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Tuesday took to Twitter to enquire about Airtel's 5G network availability. He tweeted, "How to activate 5G on an @airtelindia SIM? Has it been launched to the public?" Airtel responded, "We're ready to launch Airtel 5G services from October 2022. By December, we will have coverage in all key metros."

33.title: Russia fines Twitch for not deleting Zelenskyy's advisor's interview: Report
33.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Amazon's Twitch four million roubles ($68,000) for failing to remove an interview with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's advisor, Interfax reported. Russian authorities said the interview violated the country's laws on spread of fake information. Twitch was fined 3 million roubles ($51,000) earlier this year for hosting another interview with the advisor.

34.title: CID officials harass 5-year-old daughter of TDP leader in Hyd: TDP
34.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) has alleged that Andhra Pradesh CID officials in plain clothes barged into TDP leader Chintakayala Vijay's flat when he and his wife weren't at home. Officials questioned Vijay's five-year-old daughter regarding his whereabouts and subjected her to severe emotional harassment, TDP added. The party said officials also took pictures of the girl and her two-year-old sibling.

35.title: Andhra will get special category status if Cong comes to power: Jairam Ramesh
35.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh confirmed that Andhra Pradesh will be given special category status if the party is voted to power in 2024. He said the party would stand by the commitment made to Andhra Pradesh at the time of its bifurcation in 2014. He exuded confidence that the Congress party would come to power at the Centre in 2024.

36.title: Acid served in water bottles in Pak restaurant; manager arrested
36.article_body: Police in Pakistan have arrested a restaurant manager after two minors were served acid in water bottles at a birthday party on September 27. The minors are still undergoing medical treatment at a hospital. The restaurant has been closed until the investigation is completed, police said, adding, "This is a strange incident and we are probing it from all angles."

37.title: Russians request lawyers to help them avoid military mobilisation
37.article_body: Russians have been requesting lawyers and civil society groups for support since President Vladimir Putin announced mobilisation of 300,000 people to fight in Ukraine. Sergei Krivenko, who runs Citizen. Army. Law group, said that "we are working round the clock". "Those coming to us are panicked. They don't understand what is happening. They are calling up anyone," he added.

38.title: She screamed 'Ram', rubbed forehead on my shoe: Arun on woman he met at airport
38.article_body: While speaking about the woman he met at the airport, actor Arun Govil, who played Lord Ram in 'Ramayan', said that the woman saw him and screamed "Ram!". "She then caught my leg and literally rubbed her forehead on my shoe! I didn't know what to do at that point...She told me her husband is in the ICU," he added.

39.title: JP Nadda appoints Dilip Kumar as Sikkim BJP in-charge
39.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda appointed Dilip Kumar as BJP in-charge of Sikkim. Earlier on September 27, Nadda held a meeting with the party's newly appointed state in-charges to chalk out a strategy for the 2024 general elections. "We were told that we need to keep visiting the state and keep highlighting the issues," a source said.

40.title: 10 mountaineers killed in avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand
40.article_body: Ten trainee mountaineers have been killed in avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, said Nehru Institute of Mountaineering Principal Amit Bisht. Eight mountaineers were rescued earlier and a search is on for 11 more. Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "Deeply anguished by the loss of precious lives...My condolences to the bereaved families."

41.title: Ex-Maha Minister Anil Deshmukh gets bail in ED case; to remain in jail
41.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted bail to former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The court granted the bail on a surety amount of ₹1 lakh. However, Deshmukh will remain in jail in connection with a case registered by the CBI.

42.title: Don't understand why Rahul, Kohli are being rested for 3rd SA T20I: Ganesh
42.article_body: Amid reports of Virat Kohli and KL Rahul being rested for the third and final T20I against South Africa, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh said he doesn't understand the move as both players "had only returned recently". He wrote, "Rahul had only got his rhythm back...When you're in form play as many games as possible...That's what I believe."

43.title: Delhi's Gurdwara Bangla Sahib to get cardiology unit by November
43.article_body: Gurdwara Bangla Sahib will have a cardiology unit at its low-cost dispensary for underprivileged people by November, said Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC). "Around 400-500 heart patients will be provided free consultation services daily in the cardiology unit," said DSGMC chief Harmeet Singh Kalka. Equipment such as ECG machine and oxygen concentrator are being set up, he added.

44.title: Rest of India beat Saurashtra by 8 wickets to win Irani Cup
44.article_body: Rest of India defeated 2019-20 Ranji Trophy champion Saurashtra to win their 29th Irani Cup on Tuesday. In the game, pacer Kuldeep Sen picked a match haul of eight wickets and batter Sarfaraz Khan slammed his 10th first-class hundred as Hanuma Vihari-led Rest of India secured an eight-wicket win over Unadkat-led side. Saurashtra scored 98 and 380 in their innings.

45.title: 5G not working on iPhones yet because Apple has to open it: Airtel CTO
45.article_body: Airtel CTO Randeep Sekhon has said that 5G on iPhones is not working yet because Apple has to open it. "They are promising to open it soon," he added. Sekhon said that Airtel won't be sending an over-the-air update to make 5G work on smartphones. Instead, the mobile handset manufacturer needs to push out the software update to enable 5G.

46.title: Maha govt to set up 700 health clinics named after Bal Thackeray
46.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said the government will set up 700 "Aapla Davakhana" or health clinics in the state named after Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray. "The purpose behind...Aapla Davakhana initiative is to provide medical facilities to people close to their homes," Shinde said in a statement. Mumbai alone will have 227 such facilities, the statement added.

47.title: 'Modi' chants answer those who said Art 370 abrogation will bring bloodbath: Shah
47.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday addressed a public rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri, where he was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi'. "Today's rally and your 'Modi-Modi' chants are answers to those who said if Article 370 will be abrogated, there'll be a bloodbath," Shah said during the rally. Notably, he's on a three-day visit to J&K.

48.title: 3 of family die by suicide in K'taka fearing daughter eloped with Dalit man
48.article_body: A man, along with his wife and son, allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur fearing his 28-year-old daughter had eloped with a Dalit man, police said. The man had filed a complaint on Monday alleging that his daughter had gone missing. The woman has been in a relationship with the youth for the last three years, police added.

49.title: Mumbai metro body plans to earn ₹1,500 cr from non-fare revenue options
49.article_body: The Maha Mumbai Metro Operation Corporation Limited (MMMOCL), which is the operation and maintenance body of Mumbai metro, is planning to raise ₹1,500 crore by giving out commercial rights of metro lines 2A and 7 for next 15 years. The non-fare revenue options through which the metro body plans to generate earnings include advertising rights, food and beverage etc.

50.title: BMC to install bio-toilets in 6 wards of Mumbai soon
50.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install bio-toilets at four locations each in the selected six wards of Mumbai. The BMC had earlier started a similar project but the toilets did not work for long due to poor maintenance. "There's a pit which is...part of installation and doesn't require much digging or other infra," a BMC official said.

51.title: We'll do our best to bring Oscar to India: 'Chhello Show' producer
51.article_body: 'Chhello Show' producer Siddharth Roy Kapur said the team is "honoured and privileged" to be representing India at Oscars 2023, and they will try their best "to bring glory to the country". Commenting on claims that 'Chhello Show' is a copy of 'Cinema Paradiso', Kapur said, "It is a free country and everyone is entitled to an opinion."

52.title: Russian scientist charged with treason dies aged 81 under house arrest
52.article_body: Russian scientist Valery Mitko has died aged 81 while under house arrest on charges of treason. Mitko, a widely-acclaimed researcher of the Arctic region and one of the country's leading hydroacoustics experts, died on Sunday. Mitko was accused of passing state secrets to China during a visit in 2018. He'd remained under house arrest since being detained in February 2020.

53.title: 'Ordinary' Chinese vase sells for ₹61 crore at an auction after bidding war
53.article_body: An "ordinary" Chinese vase that was put up for auction in France was sold for $7.5 million (over ₹61 crore), nearly 4,000 times its estimated value. Around 30 people engaged in a fierce bidding war for the vase, which many believe is a rare artefact from the 18th century. "It's a crazy story," auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat said on the bidding.

54.title: FIR ordered against woman over video of dance on 'Munni Badnaam Hui' at MP temple
54.article_body: An FIR would be registered against a woman for shooting a dance video to the tune of 'Munni Badnaam Hui' on the premises of a temple in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district and posting it on Instagram. "The way Neha dressed and shot the video was objectionable," MP's Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. However, Neha later deleted the video and apologised.

55.title: Never expected big leaders' support but need everyone's backing: Tharoor
55.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that he never expected big leaders to support him for the party's President post, but he needs everyone's backing. Tharoor's remark came after Kerala Congress chief K Sudhakaran declared his support for Mallikarjun Kharge for the post. On Sudhakaran's support to Kharge, Tharoor said, "I don't need to decipher what's going...in people's minds."

56.title: US to send more weapons to Ukraine in $625 million aid package
56.article_body: The Biden administration is likely to include four High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) launchers, munitions, mines and mine-resistant vehicles in its $625 million package to Ukraine, Reuters reported. The package will be made available to Ukraine under Presidential Drawdown Authority. Through this, US will be able to transfer weapons quickly without congressional approval.

57.title: Ecuador prison gang fight leaves 15 dead, 20 injured
57.article_body: A clash between inmates in a prison in Ecuador's Latacunga on Monday has left at least 15 inmates dead and 20 injured, authorities said. Ecuador's SNAI prison agency said prisoners had fought with guns and knives before guards managed to regain control. Officials attributed the prison violence to fights between gangs over control of territory and drug trafficking routes.

58.title: Nobel Prize in Physics awarded to Aspect, Clauser and Zeilinger for work in quantum mechanics
58.article_body: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has decided to award the 2022 Nobel Prize in Physics to Alain Aspect, John F Clauser and Anton Zeilinger, according to an official tweet. They have been awarded the Nobel Prize for experiments with entangled photons, establishing the violation of Bell inequalities and pioneering quantum information science.

59.title: I'm confused by reactions to 'Vikram...', but I'm satisfied: Hrithik
59.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan said he is confused by the reactions to his recently-released film 'Vikram Vedha'. "I'm very satisfied with the film...We had fun making it, I learnt a lot. I'm happy with the final film," Hrithik added. Hrithik stated the world is saying a lot of things about his film, which is mostly positive and he's "slowly absorbing it".

60.title: If Aus Women captaincy comes my way, I won’t turn it down: Alyssa Healy
60.article_body: With Australia Women captain Meg Lanning on an indefinite break from cricket, opener Alyssa Healy has said if captaincy comes her way, she won't turn it down. "I'd really take the challenge and hopefully leave a mark on the game," added Healy. Lanning-led Australia won the 2022 ODI WC and the gold medal in the first-ever Commonwealth Games cricket competition.

61.title: Man from Liberia held for smuggling cocaine worth ₹9 cr at Delhi airport
61.article_body: A man from Liberia was arrested for smuggling cocaine worth ₹9 crore into India at Indira Gandhi International Airport. "The passenger accepted he ingested/swallowed some capsules. The medical procedure yielded the recovery of 50 capsules which further resulted in the recovery of a total of 599 grams of a white powdery substance," a statement issued by customs officials stated.

62.title: Sushmita Sen to play a transgender in her next web series: Reports
62.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen will reportedly play the role of a transgender woman in her forthcoming web series, which is being directed by Marathi filmmaker Ravi Jadhav. As per reports, the six-episode show is based on the life of prominent transgender activist Gauri Sawant. Sushmita is expected to wrap up the series by the end of November, reports said.

63.title: Was at a point of quitting filmmaking: 'Black Panther' director on Boseman's death
63.article_body: 'Black Panther' director Ryan Coogler said he considered quitting filmmaking after actor Chadwick Boseman's death in August 2020. "I was at a point when I was like, 'I'm walking away from this business'," Coogler said. He added that he didn't know if he could make another 'Black Panther' film as the passing of Chadwick Boseman had hurt him a lot.

64.title: Cleanliness, safety should be top priorities during festivities: UP CM
64.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that cleanliness, safety and compassion should be top priorities during festivities. He extended his wishes to the people of the state on the occasion of Maha Navami and Dussehra. Safety measures are being given the utmost importance at all the Durga Puja pandals and temples during the festivities by the administration, he stated.

65.title: 6 people drown in Tamil Nadu's  Kollidam river
65.article_body: Six people died after drowning in the Kollidam river near Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district, said police. They were among 52 pilgrims who arrived at the Poondi Madha Basilica from Thoothukudi. The incident occurred when the victims entered the river to take bath before visiting the church. Five bodies were found on Monday and one on Tuesday, said police.

66.title: Bengaluru civic body to restart demolition drive from October 6
66.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will be resuming the anti-encroachment demolition drive in the city after Dussehra holidays (October 6), the civic authority officials said. The statement comes after the Karnataka High Court warned  BBMP that it will hold back salary of its engineers who are responsible for the demolition drives if the encroachment removal is delayed.

67.title: I don't think so: Finch on inclusion of Cameron Green in WC squad
67.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that he doesn't "think" that all-rounder Cameron Green will be included in the already announced squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "He (green) had a really good tour of India. It was good for him to get an opportunity to open the batting," Finch said. Green scored 118 runs in three games against India.

68.title: B'luru hotel staffer peeps into bathroom as woman takes bath, arrested
68.article_body: A hotel housekeeper in Bengaluru's Bellandur has been arrested for peeping into the bathroom of a woman guest who was taking shower. The 22-year-old victim, who was staying at the hotel with her parents, said she saw someone peeping from the ventilator of the bathroom. Confessing to the crime, Pawalus Kheria said he hadn't recorded any video of the woman.

69.title: Will give reservation to Gujjar, Bakarwal and Pahari communities in J&K: Amit Shah
69.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the Centre would implement reservations for the Gujjar, Bakarwal and Pahari communities in Jammu and Kashmir. Shah also said minorities and Dalits living in the Union Territory would not have gotten reservation rights if abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A would not have been done.

70.title: Suryakumar's form is essential for India's chances of winning WC: Saba
70.article_body: Former cricketer Saba Karim said that India's chances of winning the upcoming T20 World Cup depend largely on batter Suryakumar Yadav's form. "I say this because he plays in such a difficult position," Saba said. He added, "He's got an uncanny ability to find the gaps in the right areas [and] at times he toys with the bowling."

71.title: Noida, Greater Noida gear up for 3 new Metro corridors to boost connectivity
71.article_body: The Noida and Greater Noida authorities are gearing up to extend metro rail connectivity as the process of directly connecting the Aqua Line with the Blue Line from Greater Noida to Delhi has been initiated. According to HT, the authorities are working on three new metro corridors. One of the extensions is from Sector 51 to Knowledge Park-V Metro Station.

72.title: Hyd taxi drivers seek action against unauthorised private operators
72.article_body: An association of Telangana taxi drivers has urged authorities to stop unauthorised private operators from setting up illegal pick-up points on the outskirts of Hyderabad during Dussehra festival. "This not only affects the business of taxis and cabs and the state's revenue, but also there is no accountability for the safety of the passengers," the chairman of the group said.

73.title: NGT imposes ₹3,825 cr penalty on T'gana for poor urban waste management
73.article_body: National Green Tribunal imposed a penalty of ₹3,825 crore on the Telangana government for poor urban waste management. "Suitable mechanism be laid down in two months such as user charges by households/contribution of corporate, business sectors, commercial establishments who contribute to waste," NGT said. The statutory timelines for remediation of legacy waste expired in April 2021, it stated.

74.title: Speedy recovery to our speedster: BCCI to Bumrah on being ruled out of T20 WC
74.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah's tweet after the India pacer was ruled out of T20 World Cup due to a back injury, BCCI said, "Speedy recovery to our speedster." Bumrah wrote on Twitter, "I'm gutted that I won't be a part of the T20 World Cup this time...As I recover, I'll be cheering on the team through their campaign in Australia."

75.title: Ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav’s health condition still critical, say doctors
75.article_body: Former UP CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav’s health condition is still critical, doctors said on Tuesday. "Mulayam Singh is…admitted to Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of Medanta Hospital, Gurugram and is being treated by a comprehensive team of specialists," an official statement read. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks.

76.title: 'Dear death, come into my life,' read diary of J&K DG Prisons' alleged killer
76.article_body: The personal diary of the man, who allegedly killed J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia, reveals a depressed mind fixated on death, said reports quoting police. "Dear death, come into my life...I'm having a bad day, week, month, year, life," a note read. Other pages are filled with notes including "I hate my life" and "Life is just grief", reports added.

77.title: 'OMG: Oh...' would've faced problems if it had released today: Govvind
77.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has said that his 2012 film 'OMG: Oh My God!' would have faced many problems if it had been released now. He added, "I see it positively. I'm not saying those the protestors are wrong in objecting." The film also featured Akshay Kumar and Paresh Rawal. Govvind said he signed the film as the script was balanced.

78.title: VLC media player operator sends legal notice to Indian govt over website ban
78.article_body: VideoLAN, a non-profit that operates VLC media player, has sent a legal notice to IT Ministry and Department of Telecommunications months after its website with the link to download VLC was blocked by the government. In the notice, VideoLAN demanded a copy of blocking order issued for banning the URL and an opportunity to defend its case through a hearing.

79.title: T'gana Minister fined ₹15,000 by Hyd civic body for illegal hoarding
79.article_body: Telangana Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav has been fined ₹15,000 by the Hyderabad civic body for erecting an unauthorised hoarding at Tank Bund Road. The civic body also fined Congress leader Anil Kumar Yadav ₹10,000 for putting up an illegal hoarding in Narayanguda. The fine was imposed by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's Directorate of Enforcement Vigilance and Disaster Management.

80.title: 4th accused in murder of 25-yr-old in Delhi's Sunder Nagri arrested
80.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested the fourth accused in connection with the murder of a 25-year-old Manish in the Sunder Nagri area of North East Delhi on October 1. Earlier, the police arrested three suspects in the matter. A purported video of the incident went viral on social media which showed the bystanders watching as the accused stabbed Manish several times.

81.title: US Prez Biden visits Hurricane Fiona-hit Puerto Rico, pledges help
81.article_body: US President Joe Biden visited Puerto Rico two weeks after Hurricane Fiona had hit the Caribbean island and promised to "rebuild it all". During the visit, Biden announced the allocation of $60 million in new funding through Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. At least 25 people were killed and more than 137,000 were left without power because of Hurricane Fiona.

82.title: US calls North Korea launch 'dangerous'; pledges to defend allies
82.article_body: The US condemned North Korea's "dangerous and reckless" missile launch over Japan. US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan held calls with his counterparts in South Korea and Japan to discuss "appropriate and robust joint and international responses" over the launch, the White House said. During the calls, Sullivan reinforced the "ironclad" US commitments to the defence of both countries.

83.title: Viral video shows Kanye, models walking in mud pit for Balenciaga; Twitter users react
83.article_body: Models walked in a muddy pit to display luxury fashion brand Balenciaga's spring/summer 2023 collection at Paris Fashion Week recently. Rapper Kanye West made his modelling debut as he opened for Balenciaga. "I know it smells crazy in there," a Twitter user reacted to a video of the show. "Social experiment gone wrong," said another user.

84.title: India exports iPhones worth $1 billion in 5 months: Report
84.article_body: The value of iPhones exported from India crossed $1 billion from April to August, Bloomberg reported citing sources. The shipments from India, mainly to Europe and the Middle East, are expected to hit $2.5 billion in the 12 months through March 2023. About three million iPhones were made in India last year, compared with 230 million in China.

85.title: Centre didn’t sanction single medical college in T’gana: State Health Minister
85.article_body: Telangana Health Minister T Harish Rao said while 157 medical colleges have been sanctioned in the country by the Centre, not a single college has been sanctioned in Telangana. "Today, if the number of medical seats and medical colleges has increased, it was possible because the CM has allocated more funds for the medical sector in the budget," Rao added.

86.title: 1 dead, 5 injured after cooking gas cylinder explodes inside home in UP
86.article_body: A 30-year-old man was killed while five people of a family were injured after a cooking gas cylinder exploded inside their house in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The injured include two women and a child. Reports said that police officials rushed to the spot after receiving the information about the incident and rescued the victims.

87.title: Meta closing one of its New York offices amid cost-cutting measures: Report
87.article_body: Meta is reportedly closing one of its New York offices amid its plans to scale down its expansion in the city. The lease for 225 Park Avenue South office in Manhattan has reportedly been terminated. A Meta spokesperson said the move is aimed at making "focused investments". Earlier, Meta said it will freeze hiring and restructure teams to cut expenses.

88.title: 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' has nothing to do with the old film: Zafar
88.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar shared that his film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' "has nothing to do with the old film", which starred Govinda and Amitabh Bachchan. However, he mentioned that his film has a "very interesting twist", which may act as an ode to the 1998 release. Zafar's 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' will star Tiger Shroff and Akshay Kumar.

89.title: Sorry, I'm done: Moeen Ali on potential Test return for England
89.article_body: On the possibility of him returning to Tests, England all-rounder Moeen Ali said he has had an "honest" talk with their Test coach Brendon McCullum and it's "time to close the door on that side" of his career. He added, "Baz phoned me, we spoke at length and I said, 'Sorry, I'm done'." Moeen retired from Tests in September 2021.

90.title: 28 mountaineers trapped on Uttarakhand's Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak after avalanche
90.article_body: As many as 28 trainees of Nehru Institute of Mountaineering are reported to be trapped after an avalanche hit Draupadi Ka Danda-2 mountain peak in Uttarakhand, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Tuesday. Rapid relief operations are presently underway to rescue those trapped, the CM added. The peak is located in the Gangotri range of the Garhwal Himalayas in Uttarakhand.

91.title: PFI was engaged in conspiracies: Maharashtra Dy CM Devendra Fadnavis
91.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis praised the Centre for banning the Popular Front of India (PFI) and said that the organisation was engaged in conspiracies. "The ban on PFI is absolutely correct. If Naxalites are helping PFI, then Naxalites will only help their supporters...Those who are against democracy, such elements can enter anywhere and spread chaos," said Fadnavis.

92.title: Dengue cases rise in Gurugram, maximum cases from Wazirabad, Farrukhnagar
92.article_body: Gurugram witnessed an increase in dengue cases as the number of cases doubled in the past eight days. According to district health department's data, Gurugram reported 241 dengue cases this year so far, out of which 116 cases were reported since last Monday. The maximum cases have been reported from Farrukhnagar and Wazirabad, with the areas accounting for 184 cases.

93.title: Temple decorated with ₹8-cr currency notes on walls & floor, gold in Andhra; pics viral
93.article_body: A 135-year-old temple of Goddess Vasavi Kanyaka Parameswari was decorated with currency notes and gold ornaments worth ₹8 crore for Navratri. Pictures of the temple showed currency notes on walls and floor and hanging from trees. "It's public contribution and will be returned once the puja is over. It won't go to temple trust," the temple committee said.

94.title: Rajnath Singh to celebrate Dussehra with soldiers in Uttarakhand
94.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is on a two-day visit to Uttarakhand to celebrate the festival of Vijayadashami with soldiers in Auli and Mana. According to sources, he will participate in an army event today and will have 'Bada Khana' with soldiers. He will also offer prayers at the Badrinath temple and celebrate Dussehra with jawans tomorrow.

95.title: It's not rocket science to understand Prashant Kishor's script: Manoj Jha
95.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Jha criticised political strategist Prashant Kishor over his "nothing has changed in Bihar" remark and said that it's not rocket science to understand Kishor's script. "To understand Bihar, you need to analyse it first...When Jharkhand was separated, what did Bihar get after that? The foundation of our industry was strong because of Jharkhand," added Jha.

96.title: Didn't imagine family would be destroyed: Husband of woman killed in UP fire
96.article_body: Rampati Gautam, the husband of Jai Devi who died in fire that broke out at a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, said he never imagined that his family would be destroyed in one day. Devi and her two grandsons died in the fire. Gautam said that it was his biggest mistake to let them go to the pandal.

97.title: Bajrang Dal workers clash with bouncers at garba event in Surat
97.article_body: Bajrang Dal workers clashed with bouncers at a garba event in Gujarat's Surat on Monday after finding out they belonged to the Muslim community. One bouncer was reportedly injured in the incident. "If any organiser has hired Muslim security bouncers and Bajrang Dal workers come to know about it, such clashes will happen," said Hitendrasinh Rajput, spokesperson of Bajrang Dal.

98.title: Amenities shut in Delhi's Air India Colony, residents say pressure to vacate
98.article_body: Basic amenities have been suspended in the Air India (AI) Colony in New Delhi's Vasant Vihar, reports said. The residents of the society are reportedly alleging that this has been done to pressurise them to vacate their homes. "Security and other...staff is also being withdrawn and it appears...indirect restrictions are being imposed on those still living here," a resident said.

99.title: Sweden sends diving vessel to probe gas leaks at Nord Stream pipelines
99.article_body: Sweden has sent a diving vessel to investigate the area of the Nord Stream pipelines in the Baltic Sea, where blasts triggered gas leakages. In a press release, Sweden's prosecution authority designated the area as a crime scene. European Council President Charles Michel has called the incident an act of sabotage. Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed US for the incident.

100.title: Himachal police recalls order seeking 'character certificates' of journalists for PM's events
100.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Police on Tuesday withdrew its earlier order that demanded a 'character certification' of journalists covering PM Narendra Modi’s visit to the state on Wednesday. The new notification read, "It is regretted that the...letter was inadvertently issued by this office. The...letter stands withdrawn. We welcome all the press correspondents…we’ll facilitate their coverage."

101.title: 'Brahmastra' earns ₹425 crore worldwide in 25 days
101.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji shared that his latest film 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' has earned ₹425 crore worldwide in 25 days of its release. Sharing the news on Instagram, Ayan thanked the audience and expressed his gratitude for making the film the "no. 1 worldwide Hindi movie of 2022". The film featured Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt in the lead role.

102.title: Info Edge invests ₹135.4 crore in edtech startup Coding Ninjas
102.article_body: Info Edge has invested ₹135.4 crore in edtech startup Coding Ninjas and has increased its stake in the company from 26% to 51%. Coding Ninjas' approximate valuation is now at ₹541 crore. The startup was co-founded by Ankush Singla, Kannu Mittal and Dhawal Parate in 2016. In 2020, it raised ₹37.10 crore from Info Edge in Series A funding round.

103.title: Bird flu discovered at Dutch farm; over 1 lakh chickens to be culled
103.article_body: The Netherlands on Tuesday said that it will cull around 1,02,000 chickens after authorities detected an outbreak of the highly pathogenic bird flu virus on a farm. A total of 15 cases of the highly lethal form of avian flu have been reported in the Netherlands in the past month, following dozens of cases earlier in the year.

104.title: 5 killed after car collides with MSRTC bus in Maharashtra's Latur
104.article_body: As many as five people, including two women, were killed after their car overturned following a collision with a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus in Latur on Tuesday morning, said police. The victims were travelling to Nanded after visiting a temple at Tuljapur when the incident occurred. A sixth passenger was undergoing treatment, said police.

105.title: Sanjay Raut's judicial custody extended till Oct 10 in Patra Chawl case
105.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's judicial custody has been extended till October 10 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. He played a major role in laundering money in the Patra Chawl scam, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) earlier told a special PMLA court. Raut was arrested by ED on August 1 in the ₹1,034-crore land scam case.

106.title: Traffic restrictions in Mumbai's Shivaji Park area, Bandra for Dussehra rallies
106.article_body: The Mumbai Police have announced traffic restrictions near Mumbai's Shivaji Park and Bandra area on October 5 in view of Dussehra rallies which will be held by two Shiv Sena factions. The CM Eknath Shinde faction will be hosting the rally at MMRDA ground in BKC while the Uddhav Thackeray faction will hold their rally at Shivaji Park in Dadar.

107.title: Going to auction Sridevi's sarees from 'English Vinglish': Gauri Shinde
107.article_body: Director Gauri Shinde said to celebrate 10 years of her 2012 directorial 'English Vinglish', the makers will be auctioning the sarees Sridevi wore as Shashi in the film. "I would like to use it for girls' education NGO. I always wanted to do this, but it never happened. I thought now, this would be the most befitting," she said.

108.title: 500 Mail Express trains speeded up in Railways’ new timetable
108.article_body: In the Railways’ new timetable, around 500 Mail Express trains have been speeded up, Railway Ministry said while adding that the trains will now reach their destinations 10-70 minutes faster. Overall, the average speed of all trains has increased by about 5% leading to availability of nearly 5% additional paths for operation of more trains, the ministry stated.

109.title: Wishing you a career as 'lamba & ghana as your zulfein': Yuvraj on Pant's 25th b'day
109.article_body: Wishing India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on his 25th birthday, ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Wishing you a career as 'lamba and ghana as your zulfein'." He added, "Stay blessed Rishabh...God bless and all the best for the World Cup. Happy birthday!" Former cricketer Suresh Raina also wished Pant, tweeting, "May you continue to make the whole team and nation proud."

110.title: US chipmaker NVIDIA ceases operations in Russia amid Ukraine war
110.article_body: As Russian invasion of Ukraine continues, US-based chipmaker NVIDIA has said it is ceasing all operations in Russia. The company will give its employees in Russia the option of continuing work in other countries. The chipmaker said it had maintained its office in Russia to support employees and their families but can no longer operate in light of recent developments.

111.title: Kia India recalls over 44,000 units of Carens to inspect airbag control software
111.article_body: Kia India has recalled 44,174 units of its latest model Carens in order to inspect and fix any potential error in the airbag control software module. The company also said that if any error is found during the inspection, a software update will be provided free of cost. Kia Carens was launched in India in February 2022.

112.title: Brave & poignant dramedy: Karan Johar on Madhuri Dixit's 'Maja Ma'
112.article_body: Director Karan Johar said Madhuri Dixit's film 'Maja Ma' is a "brave, poignant and to add, an audience pleaser" dramedy that hits the spot with its "relentless storytelling". He said he wants a spin-off of Sheeba Chadha and Rajit Kapur's characters in the film, who he found "howlarious". He added that Madhuri is "a pleasure to watch in every frame".

113.title: Southwest monsoon likely to withdraw from Pune by October 7: IMD
113.article_body: The southwest monsoon is likely to withdraw from Pune by October 7, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Till October 5, chances of rainfall in Pune city are less...if rains occur it'll be a very short spell in afternoon/evening time," an official added. "But from October 5 evening onwards, marginally rain chances are likely to increase...till October 6," the official stated.

114.title: Russian rapper dies by suicide to avoid serving in war, said 'not ready to kill' in video
114.article_body: Russian rapper Ivan Vitalievich Petunin, also known as 'Walkie', jumped to his death after being drafted to fight in the war against Ukraine. In his last video, the 27-year-old said that he was "not ready to kill for any ideals". His body was found on the connecting Congressnaya Street in Krasnodar city.

115.title: 2 girls set ablaze by their father die in Thane hospital
115.article_body: A 14-year-old girl and her 11-year-old sister, who were allegedly burnt alive by their father, died while undergoing treatment at a hospital in Thane, the police said. Their mother also died of burn wounds on Sunday. On investigation, the police found that the accused man was having an affair with another woman and was harassing his wife and daughters.

116.title: Prime accused in murder of J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia caught
116.article_body: The prime accused, 23-year-old Yasir Ahmed, in the murder of Jammu and Kashmir's Director General (Prisons) Hemant Lohia was apprehended on Tuesday after a major manhunt by J&K Police throughout the night. Police said Ahmed was working at Lohia's house for nearly six months and was reportedly quite aggressive in his behaviour and was also under depression.

117.title: Green can only come into Aus' WC squad if someone gets injured: Watson
117.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said batter Cameron Green can only be included in Australia's T20 World Cup squad if someone gets ruled out of the marquee tournament. "Green is certainly good...but I'd definitely give the players, who did a great job in last year's World Cup, the first opportunity," explained Watson. Green scored 118 runs in recently-concluded India T20Is.

118.title: Indonesia police chief removed after 125 die in football match stampede
118.article_body: An Indonesian police chief and nine elite officers have been removed from their posts after at least 125 people were killed in a stampede at a football match in Indonesia. The stampede reportedly happened after police fired tear gas to disperse Arema FC fans, who'd poured onto the pitch after their first home defeat to Persebaya Surabaya in 23 years.

119.title: I now work as labourer for ₹300 per day: B.Tech grad as Wipro delays onboarding
119.article_body: A B.Tech graduate said he's working as a daily-wage labourer at a construction site for ₹300 per day after Wipro delayed the onboarding of freshers. "[My family is] questioning if the job ever existed," he told Moneycontrol. "I had two more offer letters...I dropped those," another graduate, who received an offer letter from Wipro but hasn't been onboarded yet, said.

120.title: Tiger kills 10 cows in Kerala; drones deployed, cages installed in area
120.article_body: After a tiger was reported to have killed 10 cows in Kerala's Munnar, drones have now been deployed to track it, reports said. Reports added that cages have also been installed in the area and night vision cameras have been made functional. Officials said that the suspicion is that the mother was training her cubs when the cows were attacked.

121.title: MP minister asks to cut offensive scenes in Adipurush, says 'Lord Hanuman shown in leather'
121.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said that there are "objectionable scenes" in the 'Adipurush' trailer. He said, "Lord Hanuman is shown wearing clothes of leather. Such scenes hurt religious sentiments." He added, "I am writing to producer Om Raut to remove such scenes. If he doesn't remove, we'll think about legal action."

122.title: Doctor arrested for raping woman with 2 colleagues in UP's Basti
122.article_body: A doctor who allegedly befriended a woman on social media and then raped her in Uttar Pradesh's Basti has been arrested, police said on Tuesday. According to the victim, the accused took her to his hostel room where he, along with two other doctors, raped her. A case was filed under IPC Sections 376-D, 504 and 506.

123.title: One-way airline tickets from Russia up 27% from Sept 21-27: Report
123.article_body: The number of issued one-way tickets from Russia increased 27% the week President Vladimir Putin announced military mobilisation, ForwardKeys' flight ticketing data showed. Sixty percent tickets bought from Sept 21-27 had a departure date within 15 days, up from 45% the previous week. There was a triple-digit rise in one-way tickets from Russia to Tbilisi, Almaty and Dubai among others.

124.title: People wanted it for a long time: Reynolds on Wolverine in 'Deadpool 3'
124.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds said he feels "excited" about Hugh Jackman's Wolverine "coming back for another ride" in 'Deadpool 3' and added that it's "something that people have wanted for a long time". Talking about working with Hugh Jackman, Reynolds said he "couldn't be more excited" to be sharing screen space with one of his "closest friends" in the entertainment business.

125.title: 46 new EV charging points installed at Bengaluru's Nexus Shantiniketan Mall
125.article_body: A total of 46 new electric vehicle charging points have been installed at Bengaluru's Nexus Shantiniketan Mall by a Finland-based energy firm Fortum. The charging points include both AC chargers and even Combined Charging System (CCS) chargers. In April, Fortum had installed 50 EV charging points at this mall and decided to increase the points after it received good response.

126.title: 8 students get life sentence for raping minor girl in UP's Jhansi
126.article_body: Eight students of a polytechnic college in Jhansi have been sentenced to life imprisonment by a special POCSO court for raping a minor girl in 2020. The victim was going to tuition with her friend when the perpetrators dragged them inside a hostel. A policeman, who was passing by, heard the girl screaming and rescued her.

127.title: Twitter's edit button goes live for Twitter Blue members in selected regions
127.article_body: After posting its first-ever edited tweet, Twitter on Monday through its Twitter Blue account announced that the 'Edit Tweet' option has been launched for Blue subscribers in Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Twitter Blue users can now edit a posted tweet five times for up to 30 minutes and the history of the edits will also display under the tweet.

128.title: Man falls from 11th floor as doors open without lift car in Raj, dies
128.article_body: A 20-year-old man died after he fell into a lift shaft from the 11th floor of an apartment building in Rajasthan. The lift car reportedly did not come up but the lift doors opened when he pressed the button for the lift. The man was rushed to hospital and died during treatment. His body was handed over to his family.

129.title: 2 farmers hit each other with spades over ₹5 lakh dispute in UP, both die
129.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad Police said two farmers died after they hit each other with spades over a ₹5 lakh dispute in Duhai. "When police reached the spot, one of them had already succumbed to his injuries, while the other was still breathing...he died during treatment," police added. "The two were found lying on a field soaked in blood," police stated.

130.title: Denmark's Queen says 'sorry' for stripping royal titles from grandchildren
130.article_body: Denmark's Queen Margrethe II has apologised after stripping four of her grandchildren of their royal titles but didn't reverse the move. Queen Margrethe said her decision had been "a long time coming" and was an attempt to modernise Denmark's monarchy. She'd announced last week that her younger son Prince Joachim's children will no longer be called Prince/Princess from next year.

131.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's ex-husband Athar Aamir Khan gets married to Dr Mehreen Qazi
131.article_body: IAS 2015 rank 2 Athar Aamir Khan, who got divorced with IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi last year, recently got married to Dr Mehreen Qazi. Khan, who's currently posted as Srinagar Municipal Corporation (SMC) Commissioner, also shared a video of their wedding ceremony on social media. Tina got married to 2013-batch IAS officer Pradeep Gawande in April this year.

132.title: Vice President Dhankhar interacts with floor leaders of Rajya Sabha
132.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Monday interacted with floor leaders of Rajya Sabha at the Upa-Rashtrapati Nivas. Dhankhar, who took over as the Vice President on August 11, is also the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. Leader of the House in Rajya Sabha Piyush Goyal, Congress' Shaktisinh Gohil and Samajwadi Party's Ram Gopal Yadav were among those present.

133.title: Commendable: PM Modi on sculpture made with plastic bottles at Bengaluru station
133.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to praise the efforts of staffers at Bengaluru's KSR railway station who created a demon-shaped sculpture using plastic bottles littered around. "Such efforts are not only innovative and commendable but most importantly remind us of our basic civic duty of keeping our surroundings and public places clean," tweeted PM Modi.

134.title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Vaishno Devi temple during J&K visit
134.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at Vaishno Devi temple in Katra on Tuesday morning. Shah's visit coincides with the ninth day of the ongoing Navratri festival. He was accompanied by J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Union Minister Jitendra Singh. Shah is on a visit to J&K and is scheduled to address a public meeting at Rajouri today.

135.title: I am gutted: Jasprit Bumrah on missing T20 World Cup 2022
135.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022 due to back injury, penned a note on Instagram. He wrote, "I'm gutted...I won’t be a part of...T20 World Cup...but thankful for the wishes, care and support I’ve received from my loved ones. As I recover...I’ll be cheering on the team through their campaign in Australia."

136.title: Snake was also enjoying match, wanted a closer look: ACA Secretary Saikia
136.article_body: Talking about the interruption caused due to a snake entering the field during India's second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati, Assam Cricket Association (ACA) Secretary Devajit Saikia said sometimes intruders disrupt proceedings in matches. "Here we had a different thing, a snake. I'm sure the snake was also enjoying the match and wanted a close look," he jokingly added.

137.title: After fire at Bhadohi pandal, police review safety at Noida venues
137.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and the fire department officials reviewed security and fire safety arrangements at Ramlila fairs and Durga Puja pandals in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad on Monday. The action comes after five people were killed and over 60 injured in a fire at a Durga Puja pandal in UP's Bhadohi on Sunday night.

138.title: He is an understated actor: R Balki on Abhishek Bachchan
138.article_body: Director R Balki called Abhishek Bachchan an "understated actor" with a "certain casualness behind his simmering intensity". Balki said Abhishek is "no longer weighed down" by the pressure of the project, adding that he has "learnt to relax for the camera, without losing the punch in his performance". Abhishek will be seen in Balki's upcoming film 'Ghoomer'.

139.title: The Kapil Sharma Show to pay tribute to late comedian Raju Srivastava
139.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' will host some of the popular comedians in its upcoming episode to pay tribute to the late comedian Raju Srivastava. Comedians such as Jayvijay Sachan, Sunil Pal, Rajiv Thakur, Vijay Ishwarlal Pawar, and others will grace the special episode. Raju Srivastava passed away on September 21 at the age of 58.

140.title: Consider myself fortunate to be a part of 'Adipurush': Kriti Sanon
140.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said she considers herself fortunate to have gotten the chance to be a part of 'Adipurush' and play the role of Janaki aka Sita in the Om Raut directorial. "It's been a dream experience. I just hope I don't disappoint you all. I hope you like me," she said. 'Adipurush' also stars Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan.

141.title: Case filed against Hindu group for showing Mahatma Gandhi as asura in Kolkata
141.article_body: The Kolkata Police have filed a case against Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha for placing an idol of Mahatma Gandhi instead of the asura at the feet of the Durga idol at a community puja. "By the time the police came and replaced Gandhi's idol with that of the asura, our mission was complete," said Hindu Mahasabha's state working President.

142.title: Mobile data services suspended in Jammu, Rajouri till 7 pm on Tuesday in J&K
142.article_body: Mobile data services have been temporarily suspended in Jammu and Rajouri districts in Jammu and Kashmir till 7 pm on Tuesday. Jammu Zone ADGP passed the order fearing "misuse of services by anti-national elements that may cause deterioration in public order". This comes after J&K DG (Prisons) Hemant Lohia was found murdered at a house in Jammu on Monday night.

143.title: 'Adipurush' is most prestigious film in my life: Prabhas
143.article_body: Actor Prabhas said 'Adipurush' is "the most prestigious film" of his life. He shared that he said yes to the film because of director Om Raut's "intriguing screenplay and how it integrates the history and culture of India". Om Raut said 'Adipurush', which also stars Kriti Sanon, is an "extremely spiritual" as well as a commercial film.

144.title: Cried myself to bed: Rashmika on being trolled for Dear Comrade's kiss scene
144.article_body: Rashmika Mandanna said she used to wake up crying or cry herself to bed during the "painful days" of being trolled for a kissing scene in 'Dear Comrade'. She said during those days, she would have constant dreams about people turning their backs on her. "There were so many painful moments happening and painful things I would read," she said.

145.title: Delhi Police make first arrest of PFI members after ban, 4 held
145.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested four members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) after the Centre banned the group on September 28. It marks the first arrest of PFI members in the national capital after it was banned. Earlier, Delhi Police also raided 50 locations and arrested 32 people linked with PFI with the input of central agencies.

146.title: Vivek Agnihotri buys apartment worth around ₹18 crore in Mumbai: Report
146.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri and actress and his wife Pallavi Joshi have bought an apartment spread across an area of 3,258 sqft in Mumbai's Versova for ₹17.9 crore, according to reports. Agnihotri, whose 'The Kashmir Files' is one of the highest-grossing Indian films this year, reportedly paid stamp duty of ₹1.07 crore. The property was reportedly registered on September 27.

147.title: Terror angle being probed in J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia's murder, pic of suspect released
147.article_body: The initial investigation into Jammu and Kashmir DG (Prisons) Hemant Lohia's murder has pointed to the role of his domestic help Yasir Ahmed, ADGP Jammu Zone, Mukesh Singh said. CCTV footages reportedly showed Yasir running away after committing the crime. "So far no terror act is apparent but a thorough probe is on to rule out any possibility," Singh said.

148.title: Pakistani mother-daughter duo feature in Asia Cup 2022 as player, umpire
148.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Kainat Imtiaz and her mother Saleema, who is an umpire, are featuring in the ongoing Women's Asia Cup 2022. "I am so proud of what my mom has achieved. She has always been my inspiration," Kainat tweeted. She added that it was "always" her mother's dream to represent Pakistan.

149.title: Politics is about multiplication & division, not all of what's seen is true: Gehlot
149.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said politics is all about "multiplication and division". "In politics, sometimes, what is seen is not true and what is true is not seen," Gehlot added. Furthermore, he said that some organisations run news based on their perspective, which dents their credibility and does not serve any purpose.

150.title: We've our own way of playing & there's nothing wrong in it: PCB chief Raja
150.article_body: Reacting to criticism of Pakistan's approach in their recent T20I matches, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said it's easy to say that Pakistan are "still playing old school cricket" and they should start playing "aggressively like Australia". "The current team has a way to play and in my opinion, there is nothing wrong in it," he stated.

151.title: Aus to set aside 30% of its land mass to protect endangered species
151.article_body: Australia will set aside at least 30% of its land mass to help protect plants and animals in the island continent famous for its rare species, Minister for the Environment and Water, Tanya Plibersek said. The State of the Environment Report released in July showed that Australia has one of the worst rates of species decline among world's richest countries.

152.title: Journalists covering PM Modi's event in Himachal asked to give 'character certificates'
152.article_body: In order to get security passes to cover PM Narendra Modi's visit to Himachal Pradesh tomorrow, journalists have been asked to produce a "certificate of their character verification". These include privately-owned print, digital and news television journalists, and representatives of the All India Radio and Doordarshan. Earlier, PM's September 24 visit to Mandi was cancelled over bad weather.

153.title: Cheetahs brought from Namibia not Nigeria: Scindia to Patole
153.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia reacted to Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole's allegation that Centre "deliberately" brought cheetahs to India from Nigeria to ensure the spread of lumpy skin disease and hurt farmers. Sharing Patole's video clip from the press conference, Scindia wrote, "Cheetahs were brought to India from Namibia, and not Nigeria Nana Patole Ji."

154.title: Everyone in country is laughing: BJP leader on Patole's 'cheetah' remark
154.article_body: Following Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole’s remark that Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to India to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP’s Mangal Prabhat Lodha said everyone in the country is laughing at his statement. Patole said, "Lumpy virus has been prevailing in Nigeria…cheetahs have also been brought from there."  Reacting to his remark, Lodha said, "Such observation is hilarious."

155.title: Fire breaks out at Ramlila pandal in UP's Etawah, no casualties reported
155.article_body: A fire broke out at a Ramlila 'pandal' due to a short circuit in UP's Etawah on Monday. No casualties or injuries were reported but the receipts of donations and some cash got burnt in the fire. The incident took place when the Ramlila stage was being prepared, police said. The fire was reportedly brought under control after 20 minutes.

156.title: We're both daughters of India: Priyanka Chopra tells US Vice President Kamala Harris
156.article_body: Priyanka Chopra recently interviewed US Vice President Kamala Harris and said, "I think we're both daughters of India, in a way." "You're a proud American-born daughter of an Indian mom and a Jamaican father. I'm an Indian born of two physicians as parents," the actress added. Priyanka was invited by the Democratic National Committee's Women's Leadership Forum to interview Harris.

157.title: New York City Mayor celebrates Durga Puja with Bengali community
157.article_body: New York City Mayor Eric Adams joined the Bengali community in Durga Puja celebrations in the city on Sunday. He was accompanied by New York City's Deputy Commissioner for International Affairs, Dilip Chauhan. "Durga Puja celebrates the triumph of good over evil. That's something we can all appreciate in these challenging times," Adam tweeted after attending the celebrations.

158.title: Sensex surges 1,200 points, Nifty above 17,200 as IT & bank stocks rally
158.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Tuesday, with the Sensex surging 1,236 points to 58,025 and the Nifty trading above 17,200 in opening trade. All the sectoral indices were trading in the green, led by Nifty IT and Nifty Bank. Hindalco Industries, IndusInd Bank, Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports and L&T were among major gainers on the Nifty.

159.title: Odia tribal man's hand, foot chopped off for demanding wage in UP
159.article_body: A 45-year-old tribal man's hand and foot were allegedly chopped off for demanding payment for his work at a cement factory in Uttar Pradesh in September. The victim, who hails from Odisha, said he was promised ₹20,000 a month but when he sought compensation, he was given two pouches of local liquor, after drinking which he fell unconscious.

160.title: Election Commission of India makes actor Pankaj Tripathi its 'national icon'
160.article_body: The Election Commission of India made actor Pankaj Tripathi its 'national icon' on Monday afternoon. The actor was chosen for 'his association with ECI in creating awareness amongst voters'. Chief Election Commissioner, Rajiv Kumar, said that the decision to make Tripathi the national icon was done keeping in view his commitment to the cause and wide appeal across the country.

161.title: 4 Indian-origin people including 8-month-old baby kidnapped in US
161.article_body: An eight-month-old girl and her parents were among four people abducted from Merced County in California on Monday, authorities said. Merced County Sheriff's Office said that 36-year-old Jasdeep Singh, 27-year-old Jasleen Kaur, their eight-month-old baby Aroohi Dheri along with 39-year-old Amandeep Singh were taken against their will by an armed and dangerous suspect.

162.title: Ousted Burkina Faso military ruler Damiba in Togo after coup
162.article_body: Togo's government on Monday said Burkina Faso's ousted military ruler has arrived in Togo after rival officers seized power in a coup on Friday. Togo had taken in Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba for the sake of regional peace, it added. Damiba, who came to power in a coup last January, formally resigned on Sunday following an agreement with new junta.

163.title: Woman waves gun while dancing at an event in Bihar; video surfaces
163.article_body: A video of a woman waving a gun while dancing at an event in Bihar's Siwan has surfaced online. While some reports claimed that the woman brought the gun for protection, other reports claimed that she was handed over the gun by one of the men dancing with her. Notably, celebratory firing at public gatherings is a criminal offence.

164.title: SoftBank-backed Automation Anywhere raises $200 million in funding
164.article_body: US-based robotic process automation company Automation Anywhere has secured $200 million in a funding round from Silicon Valley Bank, SVB Capital, and Hercules Capital. The SoftBank-backed company was co-founded by Mihir Shukla, Neeti Mehta Shukla, Ankur Kothari and Rushabh Parmani in 2003. Automation Anywhere had earlier raised $290 million in a funding round led by Salesforce Ventures.

165.title: 35-yr-old man buying balloons in TN market dies as helium tank explodes
165.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed while he was buying balloons in a busy market street in Tamil Nadu. He died after a helium tank used to inflate balloons exploded in the market area. Reports said that several vehicles were damaged in the blast and people started running in all directions when the blast took place.

166.title: 6 injured in stone pelting during Navratri in Gujarat's Kheda
166.article_body: Six people were injured during Navratri celebrations in Gujarat's Kheda, said police. The incident occurred on Monday night when a group led by two people named Arif and Zahir started creating a disturbance, added police. "All the accused are being identified and strict action will be taken. Police have been deployed in the village," said Kheda DSP Rajesh Gadhiya.

167.title: Presented Brahmastra at international studio summit, met Kevin Feige: Ayan
167.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that he presented 'Brahmastra' at an international studio summit in Los Angeles where Disney had sent him. "I met Kevin Feige there and it was wonderful," he said, adding, "Astraverse plan came to life as we were bringing 'Brahmastra Part One' to life. I didn't always have this word Astraverse in mind when we first started."

168.title: 30 Delhi govt school principals to get training at Cambridge University
168.article_body: Around 30 principals from Delhi government schools and education department officials will be heading to the University of Cambridge, UK, for a leadership training programme next week, government officials said. The school principals will get leadership training for eight days at the university. "This will help us develop student-centric assessment practices," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

169.title: South Korean internet firm Naver to buy US e-commerce site Poshmark
169.article_body: South Korean internet firm Naver on Tuesday said that it will acquire Poshmark, a US apparel resale platform firm, in a $1.6 billion deal. Naver will acquire all of the issued and outstanding shares of Poshmark for $17.90 in cash. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of next year,  subject to approval by Poshmark stockholders.

170.title: India reports 1,968 new COVID-19 cases; lowest daily rise since May
170.article_body: India reported 1,968 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This is the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May. The active cases in the country now stand at 34,598, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,716.

171.title: Deepak Chahar one of the reasons why SA couldn't win in 2nd T20I: Nehra
171.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has praised Deepak Chahar for his performance in the second SA T20I, stating that the 30-year-old was one of the reasons why the visitors couldn't chase down India's 238-run target. "He showed great variations which were tough for the batters to put away," added Nehra. Deepak conceded 24 runs in his four overs in the game.

172.title: F*** off is my very diplomatic reply: Ukrainian diplomat to Musk on plan to end war
172.article_body: Ukraine's outgoing ambassador to Germany Andrij Melnyk responded after the world's richest person Elon Musk proposed a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine and suggested elections be held in annexed regions. "F*** off is my very diplomatic reply to you," Melnyk told Musk on his Twitter poll. "Now no Ukrainian will ever buy your f...ing Tesla crap," he added.

173.title: 40 arrested after communal clash between 2 groups in Gujarat's Vadodara
173.article_body: Gujarat Police arrested 40 persons after a communal clash broke out between two groups in Vadodara's Savli on Monday. "A Muslim festival is coming up...a local group tied their religious flag on an electronic pole. There is a temple nearby," police said. "Clash broke out after another local group went to convey how their religious sentiments were hurt," police added.

174.title: Robbers injure college student, snatch his gold ring in Pune
174.article_body: A second year B.Com student of Pune's Brihan Maharashtra College of Commerce was allegedly attacked by two knife-wielding men at Hanuman Tekdi.
