The victim, 19-year-old Varun Gupta, suffered injuries on his hand in the incident, while the attackers snatched away his gold ring. The victim was with his friends when the incident occurred, said police.

175.title: There's no other player whose absence means so much than Bumrah: Gavaskar
175.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said pacer Jasprit Bumrah's absence from India's squad will hurt them "considerably" in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "There's no other player in the Indian team, with due respect to every other player, whose absence means so much than Bumrah," stated Gavaskar. "With a bit of luck, [Arshdeep & Deepak] can fill in," he added.

176.title: Liquor sale banned for 2 days in parts of Bengaluru for Dussehra
176.article_body: In view of Dussehra celebrations, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city for two days. The prohibition orders have been issued in north, east, north-east and central Bengaluru from 7 am on Wednesday (October 5) to 12 pm on Thursday (October 6), the Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy said.

177.title: Russian journalist who called Putin 'killer' listed as wanted fugitive
177.article_body: Former Russian state television journalist Marina Ovsyannikova was on Monday put on Moscow's wanted list after her ex-husband reported she had escaped from pre-trial house arrest. The 44-year-old was placed under house arrest in August after she held a lone protest in July near the Kremlin carrying a banner calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "killer" and his soldiers "fascists".

178.title: Vodafone in talks with CK Hutchison's Three for possible merger in UK
178.article_body: Vodafone is in talks with Three UK, a carrier owned by CK Hutchison, for a possible merger. In a statement, Vodafone said that the envisaged transaction would involve both companies combining their UK businesses, with Vodafone owning 51% and CK Hutchison owning 49% of the combined business. The deal would not involve any cash consideration, Vodafone said.

179.title: Shammi Kapoor would have killed it if he could be on Instagram: Riteish
179.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh said that if late actor Shammi Kapoor could have been on Instagram, he would have killed it. "I think Shammi Kapoor sahaab...was one of the first people who were on the internet in India and he loved technology...And [imagine] the kind of flamboyance if it was Shammi sahaab on these platforms available in the 60s," he added.

180.title: Prashant Kishor is working on behalf of BJP: JD(U) chief
180.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh on Monday said that poll strategist Prashant Kishor is working "on behalf of BJP". "Kishor may give whatever name he chooses to his campaign but it does appear that he is working on behalf of the BJP. The type of publicity he is paying for raises the suspicion," Singh added.

181.title: Donald Trump sues CNN for defamation, seeks $475 million in damages
181.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit against CNN, accusing the TV network of defaming him. CNN ran a "campaign of dissuasion in the form of libel and slander", which recently escalated "as CNN fears [Trump] will run for president in 2024", he claimed. Trump is seeking $475 million in damages for causing him "humiliation and mental anguish".

182.title: Told him I'll take rain check: Ratnam on Rajinikanth's interest in 'Ponniyin..'
182.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam said that superstar Rajinikanth may have lightly mentioned his interest in being a part of  'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. "I can't just bring in a superstar, I have to be honest to the story. So I told him (Rajinikanth) [that] I will take a rain check with him about that," he added.

183.title: Cocaine worth ₹9.8 crore seized at Mumbai airport, passenger arrested
183.article_body: Mumbai airport customs on Monday seized 980 grams of cocaine worth ₹9.8 crore from a passenger who arrived from Ethiopia's capital, Addis Ababa. According to the customs, the contraband was concealed in the undergarments. The accused has been arrested and remanded to judicial custody.

184.title: Al-Shabaab terrorist with $3 mn bounty killed in US airstrike in Somalia
184.article_body: The US military said it had killed a leader of the al-Shabaab militant group in an airstrike in Somalia. The airstrike was carried out near Jilib in coordination with Somalia's government on October 1, it added. Abdullahi Nadir had a $3 million bounty on his head by the US. Nadir's "death is a thorn removed from the...nation", Somali government said.

185.title: 2 salespersons steal jewellery worth ₹8.10 lakh from shop in Pune
185.article_body: Two salespersons working at a jewellery shop in Pune were arrested for allegedly stealing gold and diamond ornaments worth ₹8.10 lakh. According to police, the accused initially stole one ornament for making quick money and then continued doing so as no staff suspected them. The police have recovered some of the stolen gold ornaments.

186.title: BMC sets aside ₹790 crore for 1st phase of Mumbai's beautification work
186.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has set aside ₹790 crore funds for the first phase of Mumbai's beautification plan which will include illumination and developmental work across the city. The civic body has allocated a total of ₹1,700 crore as part of this beautification plan which will be spent in phases over the course of the next three months.

187.title: 3 arrested for duping 50 people of ₹4-5 cr in loan fraud case in Pune
187.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested three persons in a loan fraud case for cheating at least 50 persons of ₹4-5 crore. The accused allegedly collected loan documents and a token amount of ₹2-3 lakh from each applicant, police said. "The accused did not have any licence for lending business nor did they have a tie-up with a financial institute," police added.

188.title: AAP to burn Ravan effigies made of garbage in 3,500 locations across Delhi
188.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will burn effigies of Ravan made of garbage at about 3,500 locations in Delhi today as a protest against BJP's "failure" to maintain cleanliness in national capital, the Arvind Kejriwal-led party said. AAP will hold protests after burning effigies and call for municipal polls to be held "at the earliest", AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak said.

189.title: Rana Daggubati receives golden bust of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar, shares pic
189.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati received a golden bust of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar. Sharing a picture of the same on Twitter on Monday, he wrote, "The most beautiful memory came into my office today. Miss you my friend." Puneeth Rajkumar passed away aged 46 in October last year after suffering a heart attack.

190.title: J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia found dead with slit throat, police look for domestic help
190.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Prisons Hemant Lohia was found dead at his house on Monday night. A murder probe has been launched while the suspect, his domestic help, is absconding. Lohia's domestic help reportedly first suffocated him to death, then slit his throat with a broken ketchup bottle and later attempted to set the body ablaze.

191.title: Shimron Hetmyer dropped from West Indies' T20 World Cup 2022 squad after missing flight
191.article_body: Batter Shimron Hetmyer has been dropped from West Indies' squad for T20 World Cup 2022 after missing his flight to Australia. Hetmyer missed his re-scheduled flight to Australia, which had been changed to Monday from Saturday at his request, due to family reasons. Hetmyer has been replaced by Shamarh Brooks in the squad.

192.title: India's unemployment rate drops to 6.43% in September, lowest in 4 years
192.article_body: India's unemployment rate fell to the lowest in over four years in September to 6.43%, according to data revealed by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy. The rate is the lowest since August 2018 as compared to this year's high of 8.3% in August. The decline was reported as close to 10 million jobs were added during September.

193.title: People warned to take shelter in Japan as N Korea fires missile; it lands in Pacific Ocean
193.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday fired an intermediate-range ballistic missile over Japan, forcing the country to alert residents in northeastern regions to evacuate to shelters. Japan said the missile flew over Japan and is believed to have landed into the Pacific Ocean. This was Japan's first 'J-alert' alert since 2017, when North Korea fired a Hwasong-12 missile over the nation.

194.title: 33-yr-old accused of killing constable in Delhi riots arrested in UP
194.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested from UP's Aligarh for allegedly killing head constable Ratan Lal during the 2020 Delhi riots. The accused, identified as Mohammed Wasim, was declared a "proclaimed offender" by the Delhi High Court, police said. Apart from Lal, the then Shahdara DCP Amit Sharma and then ACP Gokalpuri Anuj Kumar had also sustained severe injuries, police stated.

195.title: Hyderabad Metro launches facility to let commuters book tickets on WhatsApp
195.article_body: The Hyderabad Metro Rail has launched the facility to book tickets on WhatsApp. Commuters will be able to purchase e-tickets on their WhatsApp number. They will be required to send a 'Hi' message to Hyderabad Metro Rail on a number. An OTP will then be sent to the commuters along with an e-ticket booking link.

196.title: BBMP Chief Commissioner files identity theft complaint for 2nd time
196.article_body: For the second time in three months, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath filed a police complaint against fraudulent use of his identity. The suspect chatted with people known to Nath using his display picture on WhatsApp and sent them requests for Amazon gift cards and links for purchases, said police.

197.title: Hyd man pours fuel on his bike, sets it ablaze after being stopped by police
197.article_body: A man poured fuel on his motorcycle and set it on fire after police stopped him for traffic offence. Reports said he was stopped as he was moving in the wrong direction on the road. Traffic police alerted the local law and order police, who arrived and extinguished the fire. Police said that the man is a regular traffic offender.

198.title: Zelenskyy starts poll on Musk after his 'Ukraine-Russia peace' plan, billionaire replies
198.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy started a Twitter poll on Elon Musk after the billionaire asked Twitter users to vote on a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine. "Which @elonmusk do you like more?" Zelenskyy tweeted, with the options - one who supports Ukraine and one who supports Russia. Responding to it, Musk wrote, "I still very much support Ukraine."

199.title: SpaceX spent $80 million out of its pocket for Ukraine, $0 for Russia: Musk
199.article_body: Elon Musk has said that SpaceX's out-of-pocket cost to support Ukraine has been $80 million so far. "Our support for Russia is $0. Obviously, we are pro Ukraine," he added. His tweet came after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took a poll asking people which Musk they like more, the one who supports Ukraine or the one who supports Russia.

200.title: Riots engineered by US, Israel: Iran's Ayatollah on protests over woman's death
200.article_body: In his first public comments on the civil unrest stemming from 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death in Iranian police custody, supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said, "This rioting was planned." He added, "These riots and the insecurity were engineered by America and the occupying, false Zionist regime [Israel], as well as their paid agents." He said Amini's death "broke our hearts".

201.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook meets Pope Francis in private meeting at Vatican
201.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook was granted a "private audience" with Pope Francis at the Vatican on Monday. However, the Vatican did not disclose what was discussed between the two during the meeting. Cook had previously met the Pope in 2016. The Pope earlier warned people against becoming slaves to mobile phones and other forms of technology.

202.title: Britannia acquires 51% equity share in Kenya's Kenafric Biscuits
202.article_body: Britannia Industries has acquired a controlling stake in Kenya-based Kenafric Biscuits for ₹9.2 crore. In a filing, Britannia said that it has subscribed to 51% of the equity share capital of the company. The deal was completed in cash consideration and the acquisition was completed on October 3. Britannia said the acquisition's objective was to sell biscuits in African markets.

203.title: Lenskart Co-founder Neha Bansal buys property in Delhi for ₹22 cr: Report
203.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder Neha Bansal has reportedly purchased a 400-square yard bungalow in south Delhi's Greater Kailash area for ₹22 crore. Bansal currently has a net worth of ₹1,540 crore and was one of the new entrants on the Hurun Wealthy Women List 2021. Healthcare platform PharmEasy's Co-founder Siddharth Shah also bought a duplex in Mumbai's Khar for ₹40 crore.

204.title: 62-year-old ex-Indian Army officer completes third Ironman triathlon
204.article_body: Major General Vikram Dev Dogra (retd) completed his third Ironman triathlon in Barcelona, Spain. In 2018, the now 62-year-old had become the first serving Indian Army officer to complete the event which comprises 3.8 km of swimming, 180 km cycling and 42.2 km of running. Dogra served in the Indian Army for around 38 years.

205.title: Skipper Temba Bavuma is weakest link in South African team: RP Singh
205.article_body: After South Africa lost the 2nd T20I on Sunday, ex-Indian pacer RP Singh said that Proteas skipper Temba Bavuma is the "weakest link" in the African side. "Even Rilee Rossouw wasn't able to get any runs. Had these two (Bavuma-Rossouw) played well, South Africa would have got a better start...It is important to capitalise on the powerplay," Singh said.

206.title: Xhaka apologised to Arsenal squad at half-time against Tottenham: Report
206.article_body: Arsenal midfielder Granit Xhaka reportedly apologised to his teammates at half-time during the match against Tottenham Hotspur for his role in the penalty awarded to the opposition. Xhaka reportedly shouldered the blame saying he was unable to clear his lines, even though Gabriel's foul on Richarlison led to the decision. Arsenal beat Tottenham 3-1 on Saturday at the Emirates Stadium.

207.title: Want to keep Chris Gayle's bat as a prized possession: Yusuf Pathan
207.article_body: Former India batter Yusuf Pathan said he would like to keep former West Indies captain Chris Gayle's bat as a memento. "I get to learn so much from him. I would really like to have his bat and keep it as a prized possession," said Pathan. Gayle responded that he is open to the idea of exchanging bats with Pathan.

208.title: Centre denies permission to RJD MP Manoj Jha to visit Pakistan
208.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) MP Manoj K Jha was denied 'political clearance' by the Centre to visit Pakistan to address an event. Jha said while he got clearance from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), he was denied political clearance by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA). Jha was planning to enter the neighbouring country via the Wagah Border.

209.title: Ahead of IPO, Electronics Mart India raises ₹150 cr from investors
209.article_body: Electronics retailer Electronics Mart India has raised ₹150 crore from anchor investors ahead of its initial public offering (IPO). Its IPO will open on October 4 and close on October 7 at a price of ₹59 per share, according to the filings with the exchange. Through the anchor book, a total of 20 investors have invested in the company.

210.title: Far from acceptable: Man Utd's Eriksen on 6-3 loss to Man City
210.article_body: After Manchester United was defeated by Manchester City by a margin of 6-3 in the Premier League on Sunday, the former club's midfielder, Christian Eriksen, said that their performance was "far from acceptable". "We started on the wrong foot...We can only blame ourselves. There are a lot of things we need to change," the 30-year-old Danish footballer said.

211.title: Bihar girl who asked for subsidised pads wants to meet CM Nitish
211.article_body: Bihar girl Riya Kumari, who asked for subsidised sanitary pads from IAS officer Harjot Kaur Bamhrah, said that Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is yet to meet her. She said that she wants to meet the CM face to face so that "he can listen to what I want to say". She added that she wants to make a bigger difference.

212.title: SP workers pray for Mulayam Yadav's long life in temples across UP
212.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) workers organised special prayers in temples across UP for the long life of party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who is currently admitted to the CCU. Ajay Yadav, a party leader, said that he was ready to donate his kidney if needed. The party took to Twitter to say that it will update about his health condition regularly.

213.title: 16-year-old boy forced to perform puja without clothes in Karnataka, 3 arrested
213.article_body: A case was registered and three persons were arrested in Karnataka’s Koppal after a 16-year-old boy was allegedly lured to strip naked and perform puja to clear his father’s debts. The police said the accused shared a video of the same on social media. The accused had threatened to murder the boy's father if he disclosed incident to anyone else.

214.title: That was 4 yrs ago: Akram to Pak batter's statement on hitting sixes in Aus
214.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Wasim Akram reacted to batter Iftikhar Ahmed's saying that "hitting sixes in big Australian grounds is not a problem" for him. "I read Iftikhar's statement...He was named the Player of the Match and Player of the Series in Australia, that was 4 years ago man. This is a different ball game, a World Cup," Akram said.

215.title: ISRO issues statement as Mars orbiter loses contact, says 'it is non-recoverable'
215.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) confirmed it has lost contact with its Mars orbiter, calling the mission "a remarkable technological and scientific feat". "Despite being [built] for a life span of six months....the Mars Orbiter Mission has lived for about eight years," said ISRO. "It was declared that the spacecraft is non-recoverable and attained its end-of-life," it added.

216.title: People wrote me off too early: Archer Atanu on reaching National Games final
216.article_body: After reaching men's individual recurve final at 36th National Games, archer Atanu Das said people wrote him off too early after a "tough" Tokyo Olympics. "I was mentally exhausted after the loss...it was tough to deal with, so I decided to take a two-month break...critics completely changed the narrative," he added. Atanu defeated veteran Tarundeep Rai 6-0 in semi-final.

217.title: Lakhimpur Kheri victims' families still awaiting justice: Tikait
217.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait said families of those who died in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence are yet to get justice and the nation will never forget the incident. "The ruling dispensation neither believes in the legal system, nor the Constitution," said Tikait. Meanwhile, BKU (Doaba) members assembled in Punjab in observance of the first year anniversary of the violence.

218.title: Supreme Court sends notice to UP govt over bail to Owaisi attackers
218.article_body: The Supreme Court issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government on a plea filed by AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi challenging the bail granted to two accused of firing at his vehicle in February this year. The bench also issued notices to the two accused, Sachin Pandit and Shubham Gurjar. They were released on bail on August 3.

219.title: Video of angry Pakistani fans chanting 'Parchi, Parchi' for Khushdil Shah goes viral
219.article_body: A video has gone viral showing angry fans in the stadium chanting 'Parchi, Parchi' for Pakistan batter Khushdil Shah. Pakistani cricketer Imam-ul-Haq shared a video and wrote, "I'd like to request our fans to avoid such rants at any player as it can badly impact...player’s health." Khushdil scored 63 runs in four T20I innings against England in the recently-concluded series.

220.title: Women's T20 World Cup 2023 fixtures announced, India to face Pakistan on February 12
220.article_body: The ICC on Monday announced the schedule for the Women's T20 World Cup 2023, which will begin on February 10 in South Africa. India are placed in Group 2 with England, West Indies, Pakistan and Ireland. India will face Pakistan on February 12. India will face West Indies, England, and Ireland on February 15, 18 and 20, respectively.

221.title: ICC names 5 players tipped to shine during T20 World Cup 2022
221.article_body: The ICC, on its official website, has named five players tipped to shine during the T20 World Cup 2022. The five players are Australia opener David Warner, Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga, England captain Jos Buttler, India batter Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan wicketkeeper-opener Muhammad Rizwan. "You will struggle to find a more consistent T20I batter than Rizwan," the article read.

222.title: Delhi court dismisses statutory bail plea of DHFL promoters Wadhawan brothers
222.article_body: A Delhi court has dismissed the statutory bail plea of former Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited promoters Kapil Wadhawan and his brother Dheeraj. CBI had arrested the two accused over a bank loan scam case. Judge Vishal Gogne noted that the accused were also charged with section 409, providing a maximum period of 90 days to file the charge sheet.

223.title: UK artist 'Mr Doodle' covers his ₹12 crore mansion completely with doodles
223.article_body: British artist Sam Cox, popularly known as 'Mr Doodle', has completely covered his mansion with doddles drawn by him in two years. The mansion, initially bought by the artist for more than ₹12 crore, now has every inch, from his bedding to his microwave and even door knobs, covered in doodles. He called it his "best piece of work".

224.title: World's richest man Musk runs poll for Ukraine-Russia peace, says 'please vote'
224.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Monday took to Twitter to create a poll suggesting ways to achieve peace between Ukraine and Russia. "Please vote on this poll," Musk urged the public. "Also worth noting that a possible, albeit unlikely, outcome from this conflict is nuclear war," Musk said in another tweet.

225.title: Siva breaks 35-year-old National Games men's pole vault record
225.article_body: Siva Subramaniam broke his national record as he won the men's pole vault gold medal at the 36th National Games in Gujarat on Monday. Siva cleared 5.31m, improving his mark of 5.30m set in 2018. Siva, representing Services, broke the 35-year-old National Games record of 5.10m set by Vijay Pal Singh in Kerala.

226.title: Mamallapuram beats Taj with highest foreign visitors in FY 21-22
226.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Mamallapuram has, according to a Tourism Ministry report, beaten the Taj Mahal in terms of the number of foreign tourists visiting the spot in FY 2021-2022. The UNESCO world heritage site saw 1,44,984 foreign visitors, while the second-placed Taj Mahal saw 38,922 foreign tourists. Six of the top 10 monuments on the list are in Tamil Nadu.

227.title: Families of victims in Lakhimpur incident are disappointed: Priyanka
227.article_body: On the first anniversary of the Lakhimpur Kheri incident, where farmers were run over by a vehicle, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said that the victims' families are "disappointed" because the trial has been "sluggish". "Despite the agitation of the farmers, neither did they get the law on MSP, nor justice for the martyred farmers," Priyanka said.

228.title: This is not 2008, Credit Suisse stock 'a buy for the brave': Citi
228.article_body: Credit Suisse stock at its current levels is "a buy for the brave", but with significant risk attached to it, Citigroup analysts said. On Credit Suisse's situation being compared to the Lehman Brothers' bankruptcy in 2008, the analysts said, "This is not 2008". Credit Suisse shares slid by as much as 11.5% and its bonds hit record lows on Monday.

229.title: AAP ready to be the change Gujarat is looking for: Raghav Chadha
229.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said the people of Gujarat were looking for a change and his party "is ready to take on that responsibility". Taking out a roadshow in the state, Chadha alleged BJP was making "fake surveys" to show that it is winning the state elections. He also urged corporators to join hands and uproot the "corrupt" BJP government.

230.title: BSF seizes abandoned boat near Pak border, people aboard swim away
230.article_body: The BSF seized an abandoned Pakistani fishing boat near Bhuj in Gujarat, along the India-Pakistan maritime boundary. "A few people were seen on the boat, but they...swam towards the Pakistan side. Icebox, jerry can and fishing net have been seized," said a BSF official. In May 2022, BSF seized four country-made Pakistani fishing boats near the same area.

231.title: Youth chops off palm over corruption in Bihar, offers it to Lord Ram
231.article_body: A youth in UP's Ayodhya severed his palm after offering prayers at Saryu river's bank to mark his protest against corruption in Bihar government. Bihar's Vimal Kumar said he'd written several letters to Bihar CM and had pledged to chop off the palm he'd used to write those letters. This might change mindset of people running Bihar government, Kumar said.

232.title: India's GDP growth to decline to 5.7% in 2022: UN agency
232.article_body: A UN agency has forecasted that India's economic growth is expected to fall to 5.7% in 2022 from 8.2% in 2021. United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) said, "As economic activity is hampered by higher financing cost and weaker public expenditures, GDP growth is projected to decelerate to 5.7% in 2022."

233.title: Turkey's annual inflation hits new 24-year high of 83.45%
233.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation reached a new 24-year high of 83.45% in September, official data showed. Turkish Statistical Institute said that consumer prices increased by 3.08% from the last month. Turkey's inflation has surged following cuts to the policy rate by the central bank. The bank cut its policy rate by 200 basis points to 12% in the last two months.

234.title: RBI sells dollars as rising oil prices lowers rupee to near record low: Reports
234.article_body: According to reports, the RBI has sold dollars via state-run banks as rising global oil rates and weak risk appetite caused the rupee to dip to near record low level. The rupee was last trading at 81.90 against the US dollar, down from 81.34 in the previous session. The local unit reached a record low of 81.95 last Wednesday.

235.title: ED raids 12 firms in B'luru, seizes ₹5.85 cr in fraud case involving Chinese persons
235.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has raided 12 firms in Bengaluru and seized ₹5.85 crore in a part-time job fraud case involving some Chinese persons and apps. Investigations under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act revealed that the accused cheated people through a mobile app called 'Keepsharer', which collected money from them on the promise of offering part-time jobs.

236.title: Mahesh Babu immerses his mother Indira Devi's ashes in Haridwar
236.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu on Sunday immersed the ashes of his mother Indira Devi in Ganga in Haridwar. He also performed a puja for his late mother. Indira Devi passed away on September 28 at a private hospital in Hyderabad. Her mortal remains were kept at Padmalaya Studios for fans to pay their last respects.

237.title: Sandeep Kumar Gupta appointed as GAIL Chairman and Managing Director
237.article_body: GAIL (India) Limited has announced the appointment of Sandeep Kumar Gupta as the Chairman & Managing Director of the company. Gupta, who previously served as Director (Finance) at Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), replaces Manoj Jain, whose term ended on August 31. Gupta said the company is aligned with the government's vision of having a gas-based economy.

238.title: Punjab announces hike in sugarcane price to ₹380 per quintal
238.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has announced increasing the price of sugarcane to ₹380 per quintal from ₹360 per quintal. With this decision, the state government will spend an additional ₹200 crore annually on sugarcane. Mann said the farmers of the state eagerly want to adopt sugarcane crops under crop diversification but are hesitant due to a lack of adequate prices.

239.title: PFRDA proposes changes to allow systematic lumpsum withdrawals for NPS subscribers
239.article_body: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has proposed changes to its guidelines to allow Systematic Lumpsum Withdrawal for the National Pension Scheme (NPS) subscribers. The "smart withdrawal facility" will allow subscribers to withdraw the amount either monthly, quarterly, half-yearly, or annually for up to 75 years. PFRDA said the changes aim to make the process effortless.

240.title: Tiger celebrates 3 years of 'War', shares old videos with Hrithik
240.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff took to his Instagram Stories on Sunday to celebrate three years of his action-thriller film 'War'. He shared some old videos with co-star Hrithik Roshan. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, collected over ₹400 crore worldwide. It also featured Vaani Kapoor, Ashutosh Rana and Anupria Goenka among others in pivotal roles.

241.title: Man Utd turned down €20 million deal to sign Haaland in 2019: Reports
241.article_body: Manchester United reportedly turned down an opportunity to sign forward Erling Haaland for €20 million during the 2019 winter transfer window. United's former executive Ed Woodward reportedly didn't approve the deal due to "hefty" agent fees and contract demands. Haaland became the fastest Premier League player to score three hat-tricks during Manchester City's 6-3 win over United on Sunday.

242.title: Vodafone UK in talks with CK Hutchison's Three UK for possible merger
242.article_body: Vodafone confirmed that its UK arm is in talks with CK Hutchison for a merger with Three UK. The deal would see Vodafone owning 51% of the entity while CK Hutchison would own 49%. According to reports, the merger is aimed at creating a market-leading operator to accelerate the launch of 5G in Britain.

243.title: Centre to approach capital market to raise funds for road projects: Official
243.article_body: A government official stated that government will approach the capital market this month to raise around ₹2,500 crore to fund three road projects. The official added that the money will be raised through Infrastructure Investment Trusts (InvITs). InvITs are instruments designed to pool money from investors and invest in assets that will provide cash flows over a time period.

244.title: Man's wife files RTI to know his salary details after he refuses to share them
244.article_body: A woman filed an application under the Right to Information (RTI) Act after her husband refused to share details of his income with her. The Central Information Commission (CIC) directed the Central Public Information Officer (CPIO), Bareilly to inform her about her husband's gross and net taxable incomes in 15 days. Her previous appeals to CPIO and FAA were dismissed.

245.title: Om Raut has designed it for present generation: Prabhas on 'Adipurush'
245.article_body: Actor Prabhas, speaking about his upcoming film 'Adipurush', said that director Om Raut has designed it for the present generation. "Om designed it for the kids and families," he said, adding, "Even women love my action, so there's a lot of action. And, he designed it in a commercial way, so I think it's very happy news for the fans."

246.title: 6,093 trees felled for tiger safari in Uttarakhand's Corbett: FSI
246.article_body: Uttarakhand Forest Department felled 6,093 trees for a tiger safari in Corbett Tiger Reserve, Forest Survey of India's (FSI) report said. "There was permission for felling of 163 trees. But later, we found that 97 more trees had been cut...We want to understand how FSI has arrived at this 6,093 figure?" said Uttarakhand's Principal Chief Conservator of Forests Vinod Kumar.

247.title: India's coal production rises 12% to 57.93 mn tonnes in September
247.article_body: According to the provisional statistics of the Coal Ministry, India's overall coal production increased by 12.01% to 57.93 million tonnes (MT) in September 2022 from 51.72 MT in September 2021. Further, the dispatch of coal to power utilities increased to 51.71 MT during the last month. Coal-based power generation has registered a growth of 13.40% in September 2022.

248.title: Oil prices jump nearly $4 amid reports of OPEC+ planning output cut
248.article_body: Oil prices rose nearly $4 on Monday amid reports of OPEC+ planning to cut its output by over 1 million barrels per day, which would be its biggest cut since the pandemic began, to support the market. Brent crude futures jumped by 4.1% to $88.60 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude was up 4.3% at $82.88 per barrel.

249.title: World no. 1 Swiatek skips Billie Jean King Cup Finals due to scheduling issues
249.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek will not play for Poland in Billie Jean King Cup Finals in Glasgow due to scheduling issues. The tournament will be held from November 8-13, one day after the season-ending WTA Finals which will be held in Fort Worth, US. "I'm going to talk to...WTA and ITF in order to change something," said Swiatek.

250.title: Motilal Oswal PE arm raises ₹4,500 crore for new platform
250.article_body: A private equity fund promoted by domestic brokerage Motilal Oswal Alternatives (MOA) announced that it has raised ₹4,500 crore for a new platform. The funds were raised from high net-worth individuals and family offices by MOA for the India Business Excellence Fund (IBEF) IV. With the latest close, the overall assets under management for MOA touched ₹14,000 crore.

251.title: Fan books room for ₹23,400 for a night in same hotel as Team India to meet Virat Kohli
251.article_body: A fan named Rahul Rai booked a room for ₹23,400 for a night in the same hotel where Team India players were staying in Guwahati to meet Virat Kohli. Rai booked the room after he was unable to meet Kohli at airport and during practice sessions. Rai met Kohli at the hotel and clicked a selfie.

252.title: Mukesh Kumar learns about his maiden India call-up after being added to WhatsApp group
252.article_body: Bengal fast bowler Mukesh Kumar came to know about his maiden Team India call-up after being added to the Team India's official WhatsApp group. Mukesh, who is currently in Rajkot playing for Rest of India in the Irani Cup, said, "I got very emotional. It was all blur." Mukesh has been selected for India's ODI series against South Africa.

253.title: Haaland needs his teammates, Messi can do it alone: Man City manager
253.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola pointed out the difference between forwards Erling Haaland and Lionel Messi by praising the latter's individual ability. "The difference is that Erling needs maybe all his mates...Messi had the ability for himself to do it," said Guardiola. He added that Haaland has "incredible instincts" and he was born with the ability to score goals.

254.title: SEBI gives nod to Deltatech Gaming, Pristine Logistics to float IPO
254.article_body: Deltatech Gaming and Pristine Logistics & Infraprojects received SEBI's nod to raise funds through an IPO. As per the DRHP, Deltatech's ₹550 crore IPO comprises of a fresh issuance of ₹300 crore worth equity shares and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of ₹250 crore. Pristine Logistics' IPO includes fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹250 crore and OFS of 20,066,269 equity shares.

255.title: New pic of UK royal family taken before the Queen's funeral released
255.article_body: Buckingham Palace has unveiled a new picture of the royal family that was taken the night before Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. The portrait shows King Charles III, Camilla Parker Bowles, Prince William and Kate Middleton, all dressed in black as per the mourning custom. Prince Harry and Meghan Markle were absent from the photograph.

256.title: Johar spoke to me about 'Maja Ma' long back, I forgot about it: Madhuri
256.article_body: Speaking about why she signed for 'Maja Ma', actress Madhuri Dixit said, "[The subject] was so good, it was so poignant, hilarious. It has all the factors...yet there's a sense of humour to it." She revealed that Karan Johar had spoken to her about the film. "[He said] there's a good subject. Then I forgot about it," Madhuri further added.

257.title: Top seed Djokovic wins Tel Aviv final for 89th career title
257.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic defeated second seed Marin Cilic 6-3, 6-4 to win his third title of 2022 and 89th career title at Tel Aviv Watergen Open on Sunday. With this, the 35-year-old Serbian became the first man to win a title on hard, clay(Rome) and grass(Wimbledon) courts this season. It was Djokovic's 19th victory over Cilic in 21 meetings.

258.title: India increases import duty on platinum to 15.4%
258.article_body: The government has released a notification increasing the total import duty on platinum to 15.4% from 10.75%. The move is aimed at bringing parity in the import duty structure between gold and platinum. The government had raised the import duty on gold to 15% in July but had kept the tax on platinum imports unchanged at 10.75%.

259.title: It amuses me when people write long columns about 'Koffee With...': Johar
259.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar opened up about him receiving feedback for talking about people's sex lives and Alia Bhatt during his talk show 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "What amuses me is that there are long columns that people write...it's a frivolous fun talk show," he added. Karan further called 'Koffee With Karan' and 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' cringe binges.

260.title: Kajol-starrer 'Salaam Venky' to release in theatres on December 9
260.article_body: Actress Kajol's 'Salaam Venky' is all set to release in theatres on December 9. The film is billed as an incredible true story of a mother's strength when faced with challenges. It is helmed by actress-director Revathy. Kajol will also be seen in the show 'The Good Wife', in which she'll share screen space with Kubbra Sait and Sheeba Chadha.

261.title: Even those who spread poison are raising issues of poverty: Jairam on RSS
261.article_body:
Congress MP Jairam Ramesh commented on RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's statement on the need to address poverty, income inequality and unemployment in the country.
"Look at the impact of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Even those (RSS) who break the country and spread poison in the society are raising the issues of poverty, unemployment and inequality," Ramesh said.

262.title: Russian who masterminded JEE 2021 paper leak detained from Delhi airport by CBI
262.article_body: A Russian national, said to be the mastermind behind the JEE (Mains) 2021 exam paper leak, was detained by CBI from Delhi airport and is being questioned, officials said on Monday. The man, reportedly identified as Mikhail Shargin, is said to be the main hacker behind the alleged scam. Affinity Education Private Limited was earlier booked in the case.

263.title: Shahid inspires me through performances in Haider, Kabir Singh: Varun
263.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said that he is driven when actors do better films than him. Speaking about Shahid Kapoor, Varun said, "He's [given] such great performances whether it's 'Haider' whether it's 'Kabir Singh'...or 'Jab We Met'. So that definitely inspires me and I feel like wow man." Shahid recently featured in 'Jersey', whereas, Varun featured in 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'.

264.title: Prashant Kishor raising unimportant issues, silent on pressing ones: RJD
264.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Jha on Monday said political strategist Prashant Kishor is raising unimportant issues and is "silent on those he should speak on". This comes after Kishor said "nothing has changed" in Bihar since 1990 as it continues to be "poorest and most backward" in India. "I don't need to understand rocket science to understand Kishor's script," Jha said.

265.title: HDFC assigns ₹9,145 crore loans to HDFC Bank in Q2 FY23
265.article_body: Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) Limited has said it has assigned loans worth ₹9,145 crore to HDFC Bank during the quarter ended September 30 (Q2FY23). The company further said loans worth ₹34,513 crore were sold in the preceding 12 months. HDFC's gross income from dividends for Q2 was ₹1,360 crore, while the profit on the sale of investments was NIL.

266.title: Indian men's and women's hockey teams to play Test series vs Australia
266.article_body: Indian men's and women's hockey teams will travel to Australia to play five-match test series against the hosts' national teams. The men's series will be held from November 26 to December 4 in Adelaide. The women's series is scheduled to take place in May 2023. The final dates for it are yet to be confirmed.

267.title: Wipro, Infosys, Tech Mahindra revoke several offer letters given to freshers: Report
267.article_body: Wipro, Infosys and Tech Mahindra revoked several offer letters given to freshers after delaying the onboarding process for months, The Hindu BusinessLine reported. It quoted emails sent by these companies saying the candidates didn't meet the companies' academic eligibility criteria or assessment guidelines. "We'll honour all offer letters made to deserving candidates," Wipro said in a statement.

268.title: I wish them best: Rodriguez on ex-fiancée Jennifer Lopez's wedding
268.article_body: Former baseball player Alex Rodriguez reacted to his ex-fiancée Jennifer Lopez tying the knot with actor Ben Affleck. "I wish her and the children, who are smart, and beautiful and wonderful, I wish them the very best," Alex stated. Lopez and Rodriguez began dating in 2017 and later got engaged, however, the duo broke up in 2021.

269.title: Need wickets from Ashwin; his 0/37 is not great return: Chopra
269.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra said that spinner Ravichandran Ashwin's bowling figure of 0/37 against South Africa in the 2nd T20I was not a "great return". "Ashwin has now bowled eight overs without a wicket...I need wickets...If you don't pick wickets, you have to hold back Axar because of the left-handers and then they cash in when you have no choice."

270.title: Jasprit Bumrah ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022
270.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022 due to a back injury. "The decision was taken following a detailed assessment and in consultation with the specialists," the BCCI said in statement. The BCCI will be naming a replacement for Bumrah in the squad for the marquee tournament soon.

271.title: Huge worrying sign as Harshal, Arshdeep will play in WC: Chopra
271.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on pacers Arshdeep Singh and Harshal Patel giving away 62 runs and 45 runs respectively against South Africa on Sunday. "The two (Harshal-Arshdeep) fast bowlers together gave away 107 runs in eight overs. These pacers will play in the [upcoming T20] World Cup, so it is a huge worrying sign," Chopra said.

272.title: Internal documents posted online, no evidence of cyberattack: Ferrari
272.article_body: Ferrari on Monday said some of its internal documents had been posted online and that it was working to identify cause of the issue. Ferrari added that it had no evidence of a breach of its systems or of ransomware and that there had been no disruption to its business and operations. We'll implement appropriate actions as needed, Ferrari added.

273.title: 'Bade Miyan...' is in zone of cinema we used to see in 80s: Director
273.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar has said that Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' is a "buddy film". "It's in the zone of cinema we used to see in the 80s when Amitabh Bachchan, Vinod Khanna, Dharmendra used to come together," Ali added. He revealed that they will begin shooting in the first week of January next year.

274.title: With his current form, he can win us 5 out of 100 games: Hameed on Pak's Asif
274.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Yasir Hameed said Asif Ali is Pakistan's 'X-factor' but the batter hasn't delivered consistently for the team. "With his current form, he can win us only five matches out of a 100, which is a low percentage," he added. Asif managed seven runs off nine balls in Pakistan's 67-run loss in the T20I series decider against England.

275.title: Karnataka has the most corrupt government in India: Rahul Gandhi
275.article_body: Addressing a rally in Karnataka during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said, "Karnataka has the most corrupt government in India." "This government charges 40% commission from farmers, labourers and small and medium businessmen," he said. "Karnataka contractors wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi about 40% commission, but PM didn't take any action," he added.

276.title: Salman would look for beggars at night to donate food from sets: Jhulka
276.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka recalled working with actor Salman Khan and said she would see him packing the food on sets after the shoot finished. "He would make an effort to find a beggar, even if it was late at night...stepping out of his car and giving that food," she added. Ayesha made her Bollywood debut in Salman's 1991 film 'Kurbaan'.

277.title: Principles more important than venue: Maha CM ahead of Dussehra rally
277.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday, ahead of the Dussehra rally by his faction, said that "principles are important irrespective of the venue". Shinde faction's rally will be held at the MMRDA ground in Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC), while the Uddhav Thackeray faction's rally will be held at Shivaji Park in central Mumbai.

278.title: Telecom industry pays 58% of revenue as taxes, highest in world: Vi CEO
278.article_body: Vodafone Idea (Vi) CEO Akshaya Moondra has urged the government to reduce levies on the telecom sector to enable them to improve cash generation and increase investments in capital-intensive 5G networks. He said, "In a country where tariffs are the lowest, India's telecom industry has the highest levies anywhere in...world." Government levies amount to 58% of industry revenues, he added.

279.title: K'taka CM thanks govt employee for helping man apply for education loan
279.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai thanked Pavan, a government employee in Mangalore, for helping a man apply for a government-sponsored education loan for his niece. "Our thanks to Pawan and thousands of officers...who are working tirelessly round-the-clock to deliver such governance," Bommai said. Pavan had helped the man apply for the loan offline after they faced issues applying for it online.

280.title: Don't carry ads of online betting platforms: Govt to pvt channels & OTT platforms
280.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has issued an advisory asking OTT platforms and private satellite channels to refrain from publishing online betting ads. Saying that betting and gambling are illegal activities in most parts of India, the advisory added, "Online offshore betting platforms appear to be promoting betting and gambling under the garb of news as surrogate advertising."

281.title: Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to spread lumpy skin disease: Cong
281.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Monday said the Centre "deliberately" brought cheetahs to India to ensure the spread of lumpy skin disease and hurt farmers. "This lumpy virus has been prevailing in Nigeria for a long time and the Cheetahs have also been brought from there," Patole said while talking to reporters.

282.title: People said bad things about Sonakshi after my tweet on KRK: Shatrughan
282.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha revealed that his tweet supporting Kamaal R Khan over his arrest received backlash. "People said nasty things about me as well as about daughter Sonakshi Sinha," he stated. Shatrughan had demanded justice for KRK after he was arrested over the derogatory tweets he tweeted in 2020 and later in a molestation case in 2021.

283.title: Kim Kardashian to pay $1.26 mn to settle charges linked to crypto promo on her Insta
283.article_body: Kim Kardashian has agreed to settle charges of unlawfully touting a crypto security and to pay $1.26 million in penalties, disgorgement and interest, the US SEC said. Kardashian failed to disclose that she was paid $250,000 to publish a post about EMAX tokens, the crypto asset security being offered by EthereumMax on her Instagram account, the SEC stated.

284.title: Sarfaraz Khan scores 1 more than Don Bradman after 43 first-class innings
284.article_body: Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan has scored 2,928 runs after 43 first-class innings. The 24-year old scored 138(178) in his 43rd first-class innings, while representing Rest of India against Saurashtra in Irani Cup. Sarfaraz has scored one more run than Don Bradman after 43 first-class innings. Vinod Kambli holds record for most runs (3,109) after 43 first-class innings.

285.title: BSNL to start rolling out 4G network from November
285.article_body: State-owned telecom firm BSNL will begin rolling out its 4G network from November this year, the company's Chairman and Managing Director PK Purwar said on Monday. BSNL plans to roll out almost 1.25 lakh 4G mobile sites in 18 months, he added. He also said that BSNL is on its path to launch its 5G network by August 15, 2023.

286.title: Richa & Ali Fazal dance to 'Ambarsariya' during sangeet, video surfaces
286.article_body: A video showing actors Ali Fazal and Richa Chadha dancing at their mehendi and sangeet ceremony has surfaced online. The couple danced to the songs 'Ranjha Ranjha' and 'Ambarsariya' from the films 'Raavan' and 'Fukrey', respectively. Ali and Richa will reportedly get married in the first week of October in the presence of family and friends.

287.title: Stanford dropout's global neobanking firm Vance raises $5.8 mn
287.article_body: Cross-border neobanking platform Vance has raised $5.8 million in a seed funding round led by Hummingbird Ventures and saw participation from Global Founders Capital, YCombinator and Soma Capital. Angel investors such as Alan Rutledge and Gokul Rajaram also participated. Founded by Stanford dropout Parth Garg in 2022, the company aims to build an all-encompassing banking platform for its users.

288.title: PhonePe moves domicile from Singapore to India ahead of IPO
288.article_body: Ahead of its plan to launch an initial public offering (IPO), Walmart and Flipkart-owned PhonePe has shifted its domicile from Singapore to India. Over the past year, PhonePe shifted all businesses and subsidiaries of PhonePe Singapore to PhonePe Pvt Ltd (India), along with creating a new employee stock ownership plan (ESOP). PhonePe is aiming to go public by 2023.

289.title: Delhi HC asks woman to provide sanitary napkins to a school in return for quashing FIR
289.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed a woman to provide sanitary napkins to a girls' school for two months as condition for quashing FIR registered against her for extortion and criminal intimidation after the parties settled dispute amongst them. The additional public prosecutor has been directed to identify a school. The woman's case pertained to her refusing to pay an advocate.

290.title: Nobel Prize winner Svante Pääbo's father was also a Nobel winner
290.article_body: Sweden's Svante Pääbo, who won the 2022 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine on Monday, is the son of a Nobel Prize winner. His father, late Sune K Bergström, was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1982 for his discoveries concerning prostaglandins and related biologically active substances. Pääbo won the Nobel for his discoveries on human evolution.

291.title: €200-mn antitrust fine on Apple, Amazon scrapped by Italian court
291.article_body: An Italian court scrapped a fine of over €200 million imposed by the country’s antitrust authority on Apple and Amazon in 2021 for alleged collusion. The firms had been fined citing alleged anti-competitive cooperation in the sale of Apple and Beats products. The fine was reduced to €173.3 million earlier this year due to a “material error” in first calculation.

292.title: Hrithik performed wonderfully well, cannot imagine anyone else: Saif on Vedha
292.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who played the role of Vikram in 'Vikram Vedha', said that he never thought about playing Vedha in the film. "Hrithik (Roshan) has performed wonderfully well...You cannot imagine anyone else," he added. Saif further said it was a "very naughty" and "fascinating" character. "It's a beautifully written part...His character was definitely a mind game," Saif said.

293.title: Delhi Police register case against PFI under UAPA
293.article_body: The Delhi Police have registered a case against PFI under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) in Southeast Delhi's Shaheen Bagh Police Station. "Reliable information has been received that certain leaders, members and associates of [PFI]...are secretly conspiring to disrupt public order," reads the FIR. Notably, three PFI offices in Delhi were sealed under UAPA's Section 8.

294.title: Pune doctors urge caution due to overlapping dengue, COVID symptoms
294.article_body: As dengue cases spike across the country, doctors have advised people to take tests to clarify the diagnosis as its symptoms overlap with COVID-19. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), since January, has reported 319 confirmed cases and nearly 3,018 suspected cases of dengue. Since the start of the pandemic, 7,08,815 COVID-19 cases and 9,746 deaths were reported within PMC limits.

295.title: AI designs battery that charges 13% faster than commercial batteries
295.article_body: Researchers have used an artificial intelligence (AI) called 'Dragonfly' to design lithium-ion batteries that charge 13% faster than commercially-available batteries. Scientists at US' Carnegie Mellon University used Dragonfly, and an automated arrangement of lab equipment called 'Clio', to run 42 experiments. Clio-Dragonfly formed six solutions that out-performed an existing electrolyte solution.

296.title: Bengaluru Police urge commuters to dial 112 to report crime on buses
296.article_body: The Bengaluru Police has urged commuters to dial 112 to report incidents of molestation and mobile thefts, among others while travelling in the city buses. The police, along with BMTC officials, pasted stickers of the Namma112 emergency helpline number inside the BMTC buses. The helpline provides help during emergency situations, including police and fire brigade services.

297.title: 'Disrespect to Prez’: Delhi L-G on Kejriwal's absence on Gandhi Jayanti
297.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena wrote a letter to CM Arvind Kejriwal, criticising him for being absent from Raj Ghat and Vijay Ghat on the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri. This is not only highly improper but amounts to a deliberate breach of protocol, indicative of disrespect to the Hon'ble President of India, he wrote.

298.title: LIC increases its stake in Dr Reddy's Laboratories to 7.7%
298.article_body: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Ltd (DRL) said that Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has purchased 33.86 lakh shares to increase its stake in the pharmaceutical firm to 7.7%. DRL, in its regulatory filing, said that between June 15, 2022, and September 30, 2022, LIC purchased 33,86,486 shares of DRL, aggregating a 2.034% stake from the open market.

299.title: Indian women's team registers 2nd win in a row at World Team TT C'ships
299.article_body: Indian women's table tennis team registered their second consecutive win in Group 5 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China. They defeated Egypt 3-1 on Monday. Sreeja Akula won both her matches. Diya Chitale lost her match, while Manika Batra won. India are currently second in their group standings. India lost their first tie against Germany.

300.title: Debt-ridden jeweller's decomposed body found in his shop in Thane
300.article_body: A decomposed body of a debt-ridden jeweller was found lying inside his own shop in Thane district's Mumbra. The man was missing for five days, police said, adding that it is yet to be ascertained if the man died by suicide or was murdered by someone. The deceased was identified as Bhava Jain.

301.title: AAP govt wins confidence vote called by CM Bhagwant Mann in Punjab Assembly
301.article_body: The CM Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government on Monday won the confidence motion moved by Mann in the Assembly. Mann had moved the motion on September 27 while alleging that the BJP was trying to topple his government. After the unanimous win for his government, the CM said, "Operation Lotus [has been] defeated in Punjab."

302.title: A year has passed but Lakhimpur's martyr farmers haven't got justice: Rahul
302.article_body: On the first anniversary of the Lakhimpur Kheri incident where farmers, were killed after a car ran over them, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the "martyr farmers" still haven't been given "justice". "As always the BJP is protecting the criminals...This struggle will not end without providing justice to the food providers," Rahul tweeted.

303.title: 'Be empathetic': Delhi HC urges senior lawyers to be kind to juniors
303.article_body: The Delhi HC has appealed to senior advocates to be "empathetic" and provide enough stipends to their juniors, but rejected a plea that newly enrolled lawyers be paid a minimum stipend of ₹5,000. CJ of Delhi HC Satish Chandra Sharma and Justice Subramonium Prasad said that professionals in other disciplines also faced problems similar to the ones faced by lawyers.

304.title: Vasai man moves court after son dies in e-scooter battery blast
304.article_body: A man on Monday approached a consumer court seeking compensation after his seven-year-old son was killed after the battery of an electric scooter exploded after overnight charging in Vasai. "I bought the scooter last year in August along with the battery for ₹82,000...The battery had...three-year warranty," the man said.  The boy suffered 70% burn injuries and died on September 30.

305.title: Popular YouTuber 'Dream' reveals his name and face for the first time
305.article_body: Popular YouTuber who runs the YouTube channel 'Dream', which has more than 30 million subscribers, has revealed his face to his millions of fans for the first time in a YouTube video. The YouTuber, best known for his Minecraft videos, introduced himself as Clay, without giving a last name. He won YouTube's Streamy award for gaming in 2020 and 2021.

306.title: 'Blasphemous': BJP on crew filming inside Pak gurdwara with shoes on; shares video
306.article_body: BJP has demanded prompt action in a matter, where a film crew went inside a gurdwara in Pakistan with shoes on and shot a movie without permission. BJP claims this incident has outraged the Sikh community in India. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared a video of the incident and said, "Blasphemous actions continue in Pakistan".

307.title: Delhi govt launches Green War Room to monitor air pollution 24X7
307.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai has launched the first advanced Green War Room to monitor air pollution in the national capital. Rai said, "It will monitor air pollution levels 24X7 and ensure that all necessary measures are taken to curb the pollution." Notably, Green War Room is a part of the 15-point anti-pollution action plan announced by CM Arvind Kejriwal.

308.title: iPhone 14 Pro's camera housing hindering wireless charging: Reports
308.article_body: The large camera housing of Apple's iPhone 14 Pro is hindering its wireless charging capability in some cases, according to reports. Some users had complained that they experience excessive shaking in the phone's camera when using third-party apps. The shaky camera configuration could reportedly be causing problems with wireless charging.

309.title: It will create box office history all over the world: Milap on 'Adipurush'
309.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri took to Twitter and praised the teaser of 'Adipurush', saying the film "will create box office history all over the world". In another Tweet, the 'Satyameva Jayate 2' director wrote, "Kids, teenagers, adults, EVERYONE will rush to...cinemas for this film." 'Adipurush', starring Prabhas, Saif Ali Khan and Kriti Sanon, will be released in multiple languages in 2023.

310.title: BJP leader suspended for sharing selfie with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann
310.article_body: Former BJP spokesperson Kishansinh Solanki has been suspended for sharing a selfie with AAP leader and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. Solanki was suspended by BJP for "anti-party activities", hours after he posted the picture. Solanki has been suspended for a period of six years, a statement issued by Gujarat BJP said.

311.title: Punjab man gets ₹7,000 compensation after being served worm-ridden pizza
311.article_body: A consumer court has awarded a man ₹7,000 compensation after he was served a worm-ridden pizza in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. The man had reportedly found white worms inside the pizza and later developed acute pain in the stomach and loose stools. Pizza chain Captain Sam's and food delivery app Uber Eats have been directed to pay the amount within 45 days.

312.title: Hrithik performs 'Ek Pal Ka...' hook step with Falguni, video surfaces
312.article_body: Hrithik Roshan and Falguni Pathak danced together at a Navratri event on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced online, the actor could also be seen doing 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' hook step with Falguni. Reacting to Falguni doing the hook step, a fan wrote, "She is actually dancing better than him." "New type of Garba," another fan wrote.

313.title: Foreign Minister Jaishankar is a JNU boneless wonder: Swamy
313.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy said that Union External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is a "boneless wonder" of the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). "He certainly cannot negotiate with hard-nosed Americans," Swamy tweeted. He added, "His (Jaishankar's) dare is a joke in [the] US. The Americans across the board ignored it. Jaishankar has thus cheapened and lowered India internationally."

314.title: 27-year-old man passes away after experiencing chest pain while playing garba in Mumbai
314.article_body: A 27-year-old man identified as Rishabh passed away after experiencing chest pain while playing garba in Mumbai. The man fell down after experiencing chest pain and was admitted to a nearby hospital, where he was pronounced dead. He was a resident of Dombivili West and worked at a private company.

315.title: No competition with Nagarjuna: Chiranjeevi on Godfather-The Ghost clash
315.article_body: Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' and Nagarjuna's 'The Ghost' will release on October 5. Reacting to the clash, Chiranjeevi has said, "There's no competition with Nagarjuna." "Both the films are unique and we're trying to showcase our talent in it and prove ourselves," Chiranjeevi added. Last week, Nagarjuna had said both films should hopefully be a hit at the box office.

316.title: Indian men's team wins 3rd straight match at World Team TT Championships
316.article_body: Indian men's team beat Kazakhstan 3-2 to register their third straight win in Group 2 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China, on Monday. India were 2-1 ahead, before Sathiyan Gnanasekaran lost his second match. Harmeet Desai won the last match to help the team win the tie. India are currently on top of their group standings.

317.title: 2 teenage sisters go missing in UP; uniform, bicycle found on roadside
317.article_body: Two teenage sisters, aged 13 and 14, went missing from UP's Barabanki after leaving home for school, police said on Monday. Their clothes and cycles were found on the roadside, following which police launched a search. The girls left home at 8:00 am and their belongings were found at about 8:45 am, after which the villagers informed the police.

318.title: Pune ACB arrests police officer for demanding bribe of ₹1 lakh
318.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested a police sub-inspector for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹1 lakh from an accused in a criminal case. The ACB received a complaint against the sub-inspector and an advocate through whom he demanded the bribe from an accused in a criminal case. The advocate was also booked.

319.title: Family behind cooler maker Symphony buys ₹72.85 crore apartment in Mumbai
319.article_body: The family of air cooler-making company Symphony Limited's Founder, Achal Bakeri, has bought a luxury apartment in Mumbai for ₹72.85 crore, Moneycontrol reported. Achal Bakeri Family Trust and Achal Anil Bakeri, represented by Rupa Achal Bakeri, bought the apartment, the documents showed. Spread across 7,762 sq ft, the property is located in Oberoi Three Sixty West, Worli.

320.title: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' earns ₹17 lakh from single screening in the US
320.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' collected around $21,000 (approximately ₹17,17,000) after a single show in the Chinese Theatre in Los Angeles. As per Deadline, the 932-seat theatre was sold out within 20 minutes. Rajamouli also received a standing ovation after the film's screening. 'RRR', which had released in March, has already earned over ₹1,000 crore worldwide.

321.title: Mumbai Police arrests 4 for cheating businessman posing as CBI officers
321.article_body: Goregaon Police arrested four people for cheating a Mumbai-based businessman by posing as CBI officers. One of the accused had promised the man a ₹1.6 crore loan if the victim provided him with a ₹5 lakh commission. The accused then claimed to be CBI officers and ‘questioned’ the victim, ultimately demanding that he pay the ₹5 lakh as a bribe.

322.title: Mumbai Customs seizes 9.1 kg gold worth ₹4.53 crore over two days
322.article_body: Customs at Mumbai's International Airport seized a total of 9.1 kg of smuggled gold worth ₹4.53 crore in six cases over two days. The largest haul came from an Indian passenger from Dubai who was carrying 4.5 kg of gold dust valued at ₹2.14 crore. Officials also caught 1.4 kg of 24-carat gold bars worth ₹72.79 lakh from a flight.

323.title: U-20 world champion wrestler Antim Panghal wins gold on National Games debut
323.article_body: Under-20 world champion wrestler Antim Panghal won the gold medal in the women's 53-kg final at 36th National Games in Gujarat on Sunday. Haryana's Antim beat Priyanshi Prajapati of Madhya Pradesh by fall in the final of her maiden National Games. Antim became the first-ever Indian woman to win gold at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships in August.

324.title: Optus confirms personal info of 1.2 mn users leaked in cyberattack
324.article_body: Optus on Monday confirmed that personal information and at least one valid form of identification of about 1.2 million users was compromised due to a cyberattack late last month. The cyberattack also affected expired IDs and personal information of about 900,000 customers, Optus added.  "The exposed information didn't contain valid...document ID numbers for some 7.7 million customers," it said.

325.title: Never let gender come in the way of ambitions: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
325.article_body: While addressing an event organised by NGO Yuva Unstoppable, Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said gender must not come in the way of ambitions. "My parents always told me that just because I'm a girl doesn't mean I cannot dream big," she said. Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, who won Padma Bhushan in 2005, has a net worth of $2.8 billion, according to Forbes.

326.title: US and Philippines begin 2-week joint naval exercises
326.article_body: The armed forces of the US and Philippines launched joint naval drills on Monday. The "Cooperation of the warriors of the sea" or "KAMANDAG" is a two-week exercise which involves 2,550 American and 530 Filipino troops. Japan and South Korea will join the drills as observers. The US and Philippines are a part of a 70-year-old Mutual Defence Treaty.

327.title: 'No vandalism' says Canada Police after India condemned hate crime at Bhagavad Gita park
327.article_body: After India condemned the hate crime at Shri Bhagavad Gita Park in Brampton in Canada, Peel Regional Police tweeted, "There was no evidence of vandalism." Meanwhile, Brampton Mayor Patrick Brown said, "We learned that the reported blank sign was installed by the builder as a placeholder until the permanent Shri Bhagavad Gita Park sign can be replaced tomorrow."

328.title: He's not him-first but team-first type of captain: Sammy on Rohit
328.article_body: Praising India captain Rohit Sharma, West Indies' two-time T20 World Cup-winning captain Daren Sammy said, "He's not a 'him-first' but a 'team-first' type of captain." He added, "I love the way he captains. That's why Mumbai Indians have been one of the most successful IPL franchises." Rohit-led India won the recently concluded three-match T20I series against Australia 2-1.

329.title: Uddhav Thackeray-led party is real Shiv Sena: NCP leader
329.article_body: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase said Uddhav Thackeray-led party is the "real" Shiv Sena. "Even though the decision on which is the real Shiv Sena is pending with the Election Commission, the real Shiv Sena is the one that has the ideas of Balasaheb (Thackeray) which means it is the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena," Tapase added.

330.title: 1 dead, 64 injured after passenger bus overturns in J&K's Udhampur
330.article_body: One person was killed and 64 others, including students, were injured after a bus met with an accident in Udhampur. The police informed that the bus was coming from Moungri, Khor Gali. According to reports, the driver had lost control of the bus, which led to the accident. The injured have been shifted to Udhampur district hospital for treatment.

331.title: India Women beat Malaysia to register their 2nd straight win in Asia Cup
331.article_body: India Women defeated Malaysia by 30 runs (DLS method) to register their second straight win in the ongoing Asia Cup. India Women posted 181/ 4 in 20 overs and reduced Malaysia to 16/2 before rain halted the match. Sabbhineni Meghana top-scored for India with 69 runs off 53 balls while Shafali Verma scored 46 runs off 39 balls.

332.title: Credit Suisse shares hit record low, market value down by 60% this year
332.article_body: Shares of Credit Suisse touched a new record low after declining 12% on Monday to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year and is on the track for the biggest annual drop in its history. Recently, CEO Ulrich Korner told his staff that the bank is at a "critical moment".

333.title: Big B, Rashmika's 'Goodbye' tickets to be sold at ₹150 on release day
333.article_body: The tickets for the upcoming film 'Goodbye', starring Amitabh Bachchan and Rashmika Mandanna, will be sold at ₹150 on its release day, the makers said on Monday. The film is set to release on October 7. The Vikas Bahl directorial marks Rashmika's Bollywood debut. The family drama also stars Neena Gupta and Pavail Gulati, among others.

334.title: Money is the prime reason for taking up 'Bigg Boss 16': Manya Singh
334.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Manya Singh said money was the "prime reason" for her to take part in the show. She added she also wanted to be recognised. Manya revealed she withdrew from Miss India training to become an actress. "Since...people have liked me in real life, I'm not scared to be under...spotlight 24X7 on the show," she added.

335.title: 200 railway stations across country to be revamped: Railway Minister
335.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said 200 railway stations across the country will get a facelift with modern amenities. "Overhead spaces will be created on the stations which will have world-class facilities including waiting lounges and food courts, besides amusement facilities for children," he added. "Government has prepared a master plan to revamp 200 railway stations," he stated.

336.title: Cong on bail, 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is sinister campaign: K'taka CM
336.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said Congress is a party on bail and called its 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a "sinister campaign". "Rahul Gandhi, his mother and Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi and KPCC President all are on bail," he said, adding that all the cases against the party are related to corruption.

337.title: US startup Wisk Aero unveils self-flying electric four-seater air taxi, shares pics
337.article_body: California-based startup Wisk Aero has unveiled its sixth-generation aircraft, an electric air taxi that can accommodate four passengers and fly without a human pilot. It has a cruising speed of 120 knots, a range of 140 kilometres with reserves, and can fly at an altitude of 2,500-4,000 feet above ground. Wisk has sought regulatory approval for commercial air taxi service.

338.title: Delhi reports over 400 Dengue cases last week, total crosses 900
338.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 412 people were diagnosed with the infection in the last week alone, official data showed. Delhi has reported 693 dengue cases in the month of September, taking the national capital's total tally to 937 so far this year. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

339.title: Top seeds Bopanna-Middelkoop win men's doubles title in Tel Aviv
339.article_body: Top seeds Rohan Bopanna and Matwe Middelkoop won Tel Aviv Watergen Open men's doubles title after beating third seeds Santiago Gonzalez and Andres Molteni 6-2, 6-4 in final. The Indo-Dutch pair won the title on Sunday. It was third title of 2022 for 42-year-old Bopanna. He won the first two at the start of the year partnering compatriot Ramkumar Ramanathan.

340.title: Vijay Sethupathi to star in a silent film titled 'Gandhi Talks'
340.article_body: Tamil actor Vijay Sethupathi will star in a silent film titled 'Gandhi Talks', which will be helmed by Kishor P Belekar. The AR Rahman musical will also star Arvind Swami and Aditi Rao Hydari. Talking about the film, the director said, "Conveying emotions by switching off the device of dialogue is not only scary but also interesting and challenging."

341.title: So happy to see Rajat Patidar, Mukesh Kumar in squad for SA ODIs: Karthik
341.article_body: Reacting to batter Rajat Patidar receiving his maiden Team India call-up for the three-match ODI series against South Africa, India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "So happy to see Rajat there...deserves this selection." He added, "Well done to Mukesh Kumar too...now, Sarfaraz Khan and Baba Indrajith into the test scheme of things." The ODI series will begin on October 6.

342.title: Blockchain startup XDC Network raises $50 million from LDA Capital
342.article_body: Blockchain startup XDC Network has secured $50 million in funding from LDA Capital. XDC Network was co-founded by Atul Khekade and Ritesh Kakkad. Khekade and Kakkad also co-founded TradeFinex in 2017. XDC Network offers services like Metaverses, NFT marketplaces, oracles, decentralised email providers and cloud storage.

343.title: Chhattisgarh CM takes part in Garba Raas at his house, shares pics
343.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday took part in a Garba Raas programme along with his family members, which was organised at his residence in Raipur on the occasion of Navratri. He also shared pictures of the programme in which he can be seen playing dandiya. The event was held on behalf of Samagra Gujarati Samaj, Baghel tweeted.

344.title: Hacker siphons off $23 mn from Transit Swap, later returns 70% of loot
344.article_body: A hacker on Saturday exploited decentralised exchange platform Transit Swap's internal bug and siphoned off $23 million. However, after Transit Swap and security companies reportedly began ascertaining vital information related to the cyberattack, the hacker returned 70% of the loot, or roughly $16.2 million, within 24 hours. "We'll continue to work hard to recover more assets," Transit Swap said.

345.title: S Jaishankar to visit New Zealand & Australia from October 5 to 11
345.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will visit Australia and New Zealand from October 5-11 to strengthen India's relations with both the countries in key areas ranging from trade to security. This will be Jaishankar's first visit to New Zealand. Jaishankar will participate in an event on October 6 along with the PM of New Zealand, Jacinda Ardern.

346.title: Europe faces unprecedented risk of shortage of natural gas: IEA
346.article_body: Europe faces "unprecedented risks" to natural gas supplies this winter, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said in its quarterly gas report. It said EU countries will need to reduce usage by 13% over the winter in case of a complete cutoff by Russia. On Friday, the EU agreed to mandate reduction in electricity consumption by 5% during peak price hours.

347.title: Saif, Hrithik's 'Vikram Vedha' collects ₹38 crore on opening weekend
347.article_body: Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha' has earned around ₹38 crore at the domestic box office within three days of its release. The film, directed by Pushkar and Gayatri, is a remake of the filmmaker duo's 2017 Tamil film of the same name. The remake also stars Radhika Apte, Yogita Bihani, Rohit Saraf, Sharib Hashmi and others.

348.title: Had long gap after filming, it didn't fit anymore: Remo on Kesariya dance mix
348.article_body: While talking about 'Kesariya' dance mix, choreographer Remo D'Souza said that 50 dancers from Mumbai and local artistes were part of the song. "There was...long gap [after the filming], and when he [Ayan Mukerji] saw the movie, a dance sequence didn't fit in the storyline...So, he made it the journey song that we finally see in the film," he added.

349.title: Congress workers wish to take on BJP rather than each other: Tharoor
349.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said everybody in the party wish to take on BJP rather than each other. "I agree with Kharge ji that all of us in Congress wish to take on BJP...There's no ideological difference between us," Tharoor said. "The choice for our voting colleagues on October 17 is only on how to do it most effectively," he stated.

350.title: JSW Cement raises ₹400 crore as sustainability-linked loan from MUFG Bank
350.article_body: JSW Cement said it has raised ₹400 crore from MUFG Bank India as its first sustainability-linked loan. The company said it plans to use it to achieve its annual capacity target of 25 million tonne (MT) by FY25. Parth Jindal, Managing Director of JSW Cement, said the funds would also be used towards its environmental, social, and governance (ESG) objectives.
