351.title: PM Modi foiled divisive forces' attempts to divide the country: Bommai
351.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai claimed that PM Modi foiled attempts by divisive forces, who were trying to divide the country on the basis of language and rationality. "The countrymen are watching some political parties which are indirectly and some directly supporting anti-national elements," Bommai said. He also added that those playing politics with the nation's security will not be spared.

352.title: Apple responds to why junkyard crash tests don't always trigger iPhones' Crash Detection
352.article_body: Responding to why junkyard crash tests don't always trigger iPhones' Crash Detection feature, Apple said it depends on testing conditions in the junkyard. It stated that in one of the tests, the junkyard didn't provide enough signals to the iPhone to trigger the feature in the stopped cars. The feature works mostly only in devices that are in moving vehicles.

353.title: UP Police arrests PFI activist involved in anti-national activities
353.article_body: The UP Police have arrested a Popular Front of India (PFI) activist in Ayodhya, involved in anti-national activities. The police have accused him of provoking Muslims against Hindus and targeting members of the Hindu community through terror activities. The accused has been identified as Mohd Zaid and is said to be an active member of Tablighi Jamaat of Nizamuddin Markaz.

354.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh takes sortie in 'Prachand' helicopter, video surfaces
354.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday took a sortie in a 'Prachand' helicopter after the first batch of made-in-India light combat helicopters was inducted into the IAF in Jodhpur. "It was a smooth and comfortable flight. It can fly in any terrain, weather, and altitude," the minister said. He added, "Our motto is: make in India, make for the world."

355.title: 'Disappointing Adipurush' trends on Twitter, people call its VFX 'poor'
355.article_body: 'Disappointing Adipurush' has begun trending on Twitter as several users called the VFX of Prabhas-starrer poor. This comes a day after the teaser of 'Adipurush' was released. A Twitter user wrote, "Even the [actor and actress] don't look real in 'Adipurush' teaser." Another user wrote, "Looks like Raavan time travelled and had a haircut in the 2020s."

356.title: Will only be left with 'hum doh hamare doh': BJP leader on Uddhav
356.article_body: BJP's Maharashtra unit president Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Monday said Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray should stop taking jibes at others or else the few party members standing by him will also leave. "He will only have 'hum doh hamare doh' and there will be no one else with him," the BJP leader said.

357.title: CNG price hiked by ₹4 per kg in Pune, to now cost ₹91 per kg
357.article_body: Maharashtra Natural Gas Ltd has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) by ₹4 per kg in Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad and adjoining areas of Chakan, Talegaon and Hinjewadi. CNG will now cost ₹91 per kg in these areas. Further, the price of Domestic Piped Natural Gas has also been increased by ₹3 and it would now cost ₹52.50 per SCM.

358.title: Apple testing under-display Touch ID but may not implement it: Report
358.article_body: Apple won't release its new iPhones with Touch ID despite testing the feature, said a report. The report said Apple tested in-screen Touch ID for the iPhone and has also considered adding Touch ID to the power button, similar to the iPad Air and iPad mini. Apple introduced the Touch ID fingerprint biometric sensor on the iPhone 5s in 2013.

359.title: Randeep Hooda begins shooting for 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'
359.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda took to Instagram to announce that he has begun shooting for his upcoming film 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'. Randeep will make his directorial debut with the film after filmmaker-actor Mahesh Manjrekar stepped down as the film's director. Randeep shared a picture holding the film's clapboard and wrote, "This is a special moment."

360.title: Bhogle asks Rohit Sharma 'How do you protect Suryakumar's form?', his reply goes viral
360.article_body: Following Suryakumar Yadav's 61(22) against South Africa, commentator Harsha Bhogle asked India captain Rohit Sharma, "How do you protect Suryakumar's form?" Rohit responded, "Just thinking not to play him anymore. Just play him on October 23 (against Pakistan)...He's somebody who wants to play...who wants to keep going out there...That's what keeps him happy and we want to keep him happy."

361.title: There's no other option, India have got to stick with current bowlers: Jaffer
361.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said death bowling is a concern for India going into the T20 WC, but there's no other option but to back the current pacers. "So close to the tournament, you don't want to chop and change," he stated. Arshdeep Singh conceded 62 runs in the second South Africa T20I, while Harshal Patel conceded 45.

362.title: Unaccounted cash, gold biscuits worth ₹1.71 cr seized from passenger in Thane
362.article_body: Unaccounted cash and two gold biscuits worth ₹1.71 crore were found in the backpack of a passenger at the Titwala railway station in Thane, an RPF official said on Monday. The accused couldn't give a satisfactory response when questioned about the source of the money and gold, the official said. The accused said that he was coming from Lucknow.

363.title: Class 9 student's eardrum ruptured as teacher slaps him in Mumbai
363.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 9 student's eardrum ruptured after a teacher allegedly slapped him during a class in Mumbai's school. The Sanskrit teacher allegedly slapped the boy on suspicion of making noises. Meanwhile, the boy's mother filed a complaint against the teacher and said that doctor's report stated that her son suffered a hole in his eardrum due to the incident.

364.title: Want to learn & teach myself what my kind of films are: Rashmika
364.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said she wants to "learn and teach" herself what her kind of films are because she hasn't figured that out yet. "This is the time for me to spread my wings and do every kind of film," she said, adding she doesn't want to get comfortable in a particular kind of genre. Rashmika's upcoming film is 'Goodbye'.

365.title: Report auto drivers asking high fares for short rides: B'luru police
365.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police (BTP) on Sunday asked the city's residents to report auto drivers charging high fares for short rides. "You can call our automated IVRS to book complaints. Please call 080-22868550 / 22868444," BTP tweeted. Karnataka government had raised auto fares in November, fixing a ₹30-charge for the first two kilometres and ₹15 for every kilometre after that.

366.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook reveals 4 qualities he looks for while hiring people
366.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook, while speaking at the University of Naples Federico II's commencement ceremony, revealed the four qualities he looks for when he's hiring people. "We look for collaboration...we believe small teams can do incredible things," Cook said. "We look for creativity, for people who think different...we look for curiosity, and of course, we look for expertise," Cook added.

367.title: CIA official helped Moosewala murder accused Tinu escape police custody: FIR
367.article_body: The CIA in-charge of Mansa Police, sub-inspector Pritpal Singh, was a part of the conspiracy to help Deepak Tinu, accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, escape from police custody, an FIR said. "The CIA in-charge took him alone in his private vehicle. He did not take any other security personnel with him," the FIR said.

368.title: Path of truth is not easy: Kejriwal to Satyendar Jain on his birthday
368.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday wished AAP minister Satyendar Jain on his birthday, saying that path of truth is not easy. "He's been in jail for four months due to a fake case," Kejriwal tweeted. "He gave mohalla clinics...arranged for free and good treatment for everyone. These people want to stop welfare work for the public," he added.

369.title: Stop the spiral of violence and death in Ukraine: Pope Francis to Putin
369.article_body: Pope Francis "begged" Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the "spiral of violence and death" in Ukraine, adding that the crisis was risking a nuclear escalation with catastrophic global consequences. He condemned Russia's annexation of Ukrainian territories as being against international law. "I address...President of Ukraine to be open to a serious peace proposal," he added.

370.title: Nobel Prize in Medicine awarded to Svante Pääbo for his discoveries on human evolution
370.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine has been awarded to Sweden's Svante Pääbo "for his discoveries concerning the genomes of extinct hominins and human evolution". Pääbo made the discovery of an extinct hominin, the Denisova, and found that gene transfer had occurred from extinct hominins to Homo sapiens. The Nobel Assembly said that Pääbo's discovery has physiological relevance.

371.title: He's a wonderful actor, I'm pleased: Rahul on Kartik being cast in Aashiqui 3
371.article_body: Actor Rahul Roy, who made his debut with 'Aashiqui', spoke about Kartik Aaryan being cast in the third instalment of the franchise. He called Kartik a "wonderful young actor" and said that he's pleased with the casting."He has a history of picking...right films...The box-office figures are also working in Kartik's favour, so I wish him all the best," Rahul stated.

372.title: Many teams will fear playing us at T20 WC: Moeen after Eng's T20Is win vs Pak
372.article_body: Following England's 4-3 win in T20I series against Pakistan, England stand-in skipper Moeen Ali said his side is a very dangerous team to play and a lot of teams will fear playing them at upcoming T20 World Cup. "We're in a very good position now going into...World Cup," he added. England beat Pakistan by 67 runs in seventh T20I.

373.title: 2 B'luru employees found doing subpar work booked for rigging interviews
373.article_body: Siemens Healthcare, located in Bengaluru's Electronic City, has filed a case against two newly-recruited software developers and another person for allegedly rigging the interview process. The case came to light after the developers' seniors noticed they were doing subpar work. The third person, a hiring executive, was paid for telling the developers the technical questions before the interview.

374.title: If Bumrah is not available, then Mohammed Siraj: Shane Watson
374.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said pacer Mohammed Siraj should replace Jasprit Bumrah in India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup if the latter is ruled out of the tournament. "Without Bumrah, [firepower] is the one thing India won't necessarily have...Siraj is great with the brand new ball. He is fast, he swings the ball away," added Watson.

375.title: Ex-UP CM & SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted to CCU at Gurugram hospital
375.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav has been admitted to the Critical Care Unit (CCU) at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram. Yadav is being treated by a comprehensive team of specialists, the hospital said. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks.

376.title: Hearing great reviews, not surprised: 'Ponniyin...' actor Jayam on 'Vikram...'
376.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan' actor Jayam Ravi took to Twitter and praised Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha'. He wrote, "Hearing great reviews about #VikramVedha...and I'm not surprised as...Tamil version was a knockout," he wrote, tagging Pushkar and Gayatri, the filmmaker duo who helmed the original film and its remake. "A big congrats to Hrithik & Saif for...success," Jayam added.

377.title: Ananya is very smart, she knows how to handle herself: Bhavana Pandey
377.article_body: Speaking about actress Ananya Panday's professional and personal choices, her mother Bhavana Pandey has said that Ananya is a smart and intelligent girl, who knows how to handle herself. "When Ananya joined the industry, she was 18 or 19 years old...that's the age when maximum learning happens," she added. Bhavana stated Ananya "literally" grew up in front of the camera.

378.title: Nykaa board announces 5:1 bonus shares issue, stock surges 11%
378.article_body: The board of FSN E-Commerce Ventures, Nykaa's parent company, has announced five bonus shares for each share a shareholder holds, the company informed the stock exchanges. Shares of FSN E-Commerce Ventures surged 11% to the day's high price of ₹1,414 on Monday after the 5:1 bonus share issue announcement. Bonus shares are fully paid additional shares issued to existing shareholders.

379.title: Man who threatened Maha CM Shinde arrested, full attention on his security: Fadnavis
379.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the person who threatened state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has been arrested. Fadnavis further said that full attention is being paid to the security of the Chief Minister. The accused had called up the police control room claiming a "plot" to kill Chief Minister Shinde at a hotel in Lonavala.

380.title: No bigger dream than this: Karan on working with Sunny Deol in 'Apne 2'
380.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol and his son Karan Deol will share screen space in 'Apne 2'. Talking about working with his father, Karan said, "No bigger dream than this where I am getting not only to work with him but also to share the screen space with him." Karan made his debut with the 2019 film 'Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas'.

381.title: EV finance firm Mufin Green raises $5.7 million in funding
381.article_body: Electric vehicle financing company Mufin Green Finance has secured $5.7 million in a Series A funding round led by Incofin India Progress Fund. In August this year, Mufin Group renamed its subsidiary APM Finvest to Mufin Green Finance Limited. The newly-listed non-banking finance company claims to have financed electric vehicles worth more than $19 million (₹160 crore) across nine states.

382.title: Bypolls to 7 Assembly seats across 6 states to be held on November 3
382.article_body: By-elections to seven Assembly seats across six states will be held on November 3. The elections will be held in Maharashtra, Bihar, Odisha, Haryana, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh. The results will be announced on November 6. A schedule shared by the Election Commission of India also mentioned that the last date for withdrawal of candidatures will be October 17.

383.title: Urmila Matondkar to make OTT debut with web series 'Tiwari'
383.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar is making her OTT debut with a thriller web series, titled 'Tiwari'. "This one offered me characters and a story arc that is challenging as a performer and things that I haven't attempted so far," she said. She added that the series is an emotional mother-daughter story at its core, with "some thrilling twists and turns".

384.title: No intention of contesting polls, will make good films on politics: Kangana
384.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she has no intentions of contesting the elections. "I look forward to serving those who are doing good for the country...Will do all kinds of propaganda for those who are serving the country...I am interested in politics as an artist. Will make good films on politics," she added.

385.title: CPWD invites pre-qualified bids for ₹360 crore PM’s residential complex
385.article_body: The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) has invited pre-qualification bids for the ₹360 crore Prime Minister's residential complex. Reports said that the complex will be completed within 21 months from the date of award of the tender. It will be ground plus one storey and will include a guest house, Special Protection Group office, support staff quarters and CPWD office.

386.title: Farhan Akhtar, you front organisation called MARD: Sona on Sajid Khan
386.article_body: Speaking about Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation, Sona Mohapatra tweeted, "Dear Farhan Akhtar, you front an organisation called 'MARD'...Speak up...only when it's convenient or pays to virtue signal for 'our cause' not now?" In another tweet, Sona called TV channels and executives "depraved and sad lot". Sajid was accused of sexual misconduct by many women during the #MeToo movement.

387.title: Apple acknowledges microphone issue in Watch Series 8 and Ultra
387.article_body: Apple has acknowledged that some Watch Series 8 and Ultra users may experience microphone issues, MacRumors reported citing a memo. It said the users may face trouble when trying to use Siri or making a phone call, among other things. Apple said restarting the device may temporarily fix the problem and suggested the problem is not hardware related.

388.title: Pastor kills neighbour's pet dog with air gun in Andhra; booked
388.article_body: A 65-year-old pastor was booked for allegedly shooting his neighbour's pet dog with an air gun and killing it under Nandigama police station limits in Andhra Pradesh. The incident took place when the dog started barking after entering the pastor's home, a police officer said. "[The pastor] had warned...neighbours against this several times in the past," the police officer added.

389.title: Delhi govt initiates trial run of 26 new bus routes in city
389.article_body: The Delhi government initiated the trial run of 26 new bus routes in the city. The routes were drawn up under a route rationalisation plan to provide better connectivity to major crowd centres, including poorly served areas, officials said. A four-member committee was formed to oversee the rationalisation plan to make sure that bus routes are evenly spread across Delhi.

390.title: Adam Gilchrist names his 5 players for dream World T20I XI
390.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist has named the first five players he would pick in a dream World T20I XI. He included Australia opener David Warner, Pakistan captain Babar Azam, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan and England white-ball captain Jos Buttler. "He is just an awesome figure straight across the board," Gilchrist said about Pandya.

391.title: Will show unknown facets of her life: Madhubala’s sister on actress' biopic
391.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Brij Bhushan said the late actress' biopic "will showcase several unknown facets" of her life. She said the film will put several inaccuracies about her life to rest. Madhur added that she won't let anyone else make any project based on or inspired by Madhubala's life and called the biopic her "family's emotional and legal right".

392.title: China's Geely buys 7.6% stake in Aston Martin
392.article_body: China-based Zhejiang Geely announced on Friday that it has bought a 7.6% stake in British luxury carmaker Aston Martin. However, the financial details of the deal were not disclosed. Geely's stake is valued at about $74 million, based on Thursday's closing share price. Aston Martin also separately announced the completion of a $732 million capital raise.

393.title: 35-yr-old man dies while dancing, his 66-yr-old father dies of shock in Maha
393.article_body: A 35-year-old man collapsed and died while dancing at a garba event in Maharashtra's Virar, the police said on Monday. The man was rushed to the hospital by his 66-year-old father and was declared dead on arrival. On hearing about his son's death, the father also collapsed and died on the spot, the police said.

394.title: What a disgrace: Infosys ex-CFO Pai on B'luru in bottom 3 in cleanliness rankings
394.article_body: Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai took to Twitter to share his disappointment after Bengaluru was ranked 43rd among 45 cities in the government's latest Swachh Survekshan rankings. "What a disgrace! India's only global city, the richest city has become a garbage city! We are ashamed," he tweeted. Demanding "urgent reforms", Pai tagged Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai in his tweet.

395.title: Met Gala 2023 to celebrate work of late designer Karl Lagerfeld
395.article_body: Met Gala 2023 will celebrate the work of the late German-born couturier Karl Lagerfeld, who passed away in 2019. The Met Gala theme is borrowed from the accompanying exhibit at the Met's Costume Institute, titled 'Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty'. The exhibition will gather around 150 of Karl's creations to explore his "stylistic language".

396.title: I'm scared, Pakistan might crash out in 1st round of 2022 T20 WC: Akhtar
396.article_body: Criticising the Babar Azam-led Pakistan, ex-pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said their middle-order is "not good" going into the 2022 T20 World Cup. "With this team, we might get knocked out in the first round itself. I'm really scared as our batting has no depth. Our captain is also not cut out for this format...He wants to look classic," stated Shoaib.

397.title: Businessman, actor, filmmaker Atlas Ramachandran passes away at 80 in Dubai
397.article_body: Kerala-born businessman MM Ramachandran, popularly known as Atlas Ramachandran, passed away at the age of 80 in Dubai on Sunday night after a cardiac arrest, according to reports. He was the founder of now-defunct Atlas Jewellery and produced several Malayalam films. He had also acted in several films.

398.title: Half of mobilised men in Russian region sent home, commissar fired
398.article_body: The military commissar of Russia's Khabarovsk, Yuri Laiko, was removed after half of the newly mobilised personnel were sent home as they failed to meet the draft criteria, region's Governor Mikhail Degtyaryov said. "Removal of the commissar would not affect the mobilisation plan," he added. Officials and citizens have complained that enlistment officers sent call-up papers to ineligible men.

399.title: Kareena gets scared as man keeps hand on her shoulder for selfies; video surfaces
399.article_body: A video showing actress Kareena Kapoor Khan getting scared and uncomfortable after a man kept his hand on her shoulder for selfies at Mumbai airport is being widely circulated on social media. Kareena's security staff could be seen pushing the man away. The actress was surrounded by a group of fans who were trying to click pictures with her.

400.title: PM Modi to inaugurate UN Geospatial Information Congress in Hyd
400.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate UN Geospatial Information Congress in Hyderabad on October 11. The conference's theme is "Geo-Enabling the Global Village: No one should be left behind". PM Modi-led government is "playing an enabler's role in expanding...scope of geospatial applications in multiple spheres to benefit every section of the society in India," Union Minister Jitendra Singh said.

401.title: Celsius' ex-CEO withdrew $10 million before firm froze customer accounts: Report
401.article_body: Founder and former CEO of Celsius Network Alex Mashinsky allegedly withdrew $10 million from the cryptocurrency platform weeks before it froze customer funds and filed bankruptcy, as per a report. He reportedly withdrew the funds in "mid to late May" while the platform paused customer withdrawals in June. Celsius in July filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy citing "extreme market conditions".

402.title: Pune secures 9th rank among 45 cities in Swachh Survekshan
402.article_body: Pune city’s ranking has dropped to ninth from last year's fifth in terms of cleanliness in the Centre's annual Swachh Survekshan. Indore was adjudged the country's cleanest city for the sixth time in a row. The Swachh Survekshan competition is organised every year by the central government among 45 cities with a population of more than 10 lakh people.
